The town's primary trade good is the Holthusen Hogshead barrel which is used across the empire to age or ferment their products before shipment. The barrels are said to be so sturdy as to be able to protect their contents even from direct cannon fire. Every year Holthusen hosts the Weinfest, a great gathering for wine tasting that requires an invite to enter. Of course the lack of invite does not stop the horde of wastrels and rogues who wish to drink the free wine provided by the festival. Weinfest also marks the only time of year during which the Golden Cask is brought out, which is said to contain the best wine in the Empire if not the entire Old World. Due to the town's forested location, it is frequently attacked by beastmen. The palisades and guards are normally strong enough to see the monsters off, but the townspeople fear the day this defence falls short. As such, some of the townspeople have been leaving casks of cheap wine at the edge of the woods in an attempt to appease the beastmen with tribute. This dubious practice likely will not be allowed to continue much longer.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL2_2}Eilhart
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL2_2}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the Reiklands best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_RL3}Helmgart
Settlement.text: {=!}At the head of the Axe Bite pass sits the town of Helmgart. Ruled by Margrave Reinhardt von Mackensen, the fortress town serves as both the economic and military border between Bretonnia and the Empire. Axe Bite is one of three mountain passes through the Grey mountains; as such the safety of passage through it is a primary concern. Helmgart itself is a market town, surrounded by several curtain walls. One of these walls traverses the entire width of the pass itself, meaning all travel must pass through its single gate or be stuck on either the Bretonnian or Imperial side of the border.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL3_1}Ussingen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL3_1}Ussingen is a small village located on the road between Holthusen and Osburg. The town is at the furthest point that the River Schilder remains navigable by barge, meaning that many shipments bound for Helmgart will arrive first here. The people here raise crops along the river Schilder and will venture into the nearby Grey Mountains to mine seams of ore. The town is well protected by the walls at Helmgart, and really only worries about the denizens of the Reikwald.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL3_2}Morlenfurt
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL3_2}Morlenfurt is a small village near the headwaters of the river Bogen. The town is known for its silver mines and the small community of Dwarfs which contribute to the silver trade within the Reikland.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_RL4}Bögenhafen
Settlement.text: {=!}Bögenhafen is a prominent market town that sits on either side of the River Bögen. It is midway between Altdorf and Montfort allowing the town to maintain its economic importance through nearly any hardship. The northside of the town, known as the Pit, is the smallest and poorest section of Bögenhafen. The Southside of the town is where most of the wealth and all of the town’s important institutions reside, including its religious temples and town hall. A town council rules in the name of Graf Wilhelm von Saponatheim.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL4_1}Osburg
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL4_1}At the foot of the Axe Bite Pass sits the village of Osburg, the last Imperial settlement before the Market fortress of Helmgart and the Imperial/Bretonnian border. Any shipments bound for Helmgart must pass first through Osburg, and this source of trade makes the merchants here fairly prosperous.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL4_2}Herzhald
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL4_2}To the north northwest of Bögenhafen is the timber producing village of Herzhald. Situated deep in the Reikwald, Herzhald is known for the quality and lengths of its timber samples, much of which is sent to Bögenhafen and Grünburg for their boatbuilding.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_RL5}Ubersreik
Settlement.text: {=!}Ubersreik is one of the most important trade centers in Reikland. It sits astride and important bridge on the road from from Bögenhafen to Dunkelburg. Trade flows along the road as well as downriver to Auerswald, Grünburg, Kemperbad, and Altdorf. In addition, because it is located near Grey Lady Pass, Ubersreik is the ideal location for merchants travelling over the Grey Mountains to move their wares from the river to overland transportation, and vice versa.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL5_1}Greissbach
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL5_1}Geissbach is a forest village just north of Ubersreik. The people here carefully timber the woods nearby and grow what crops they can in the clearings around the village. For a long time there have been rumors and worries about a dark estate just east of the village, which is said to house great evil.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL5_2}Tallerhof
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL1_2}Tallerhof is a small village that sits where the Grey Lady Road meets the Dwarf Road. It astrides the river Teufel and marks the highest place where the river is still navigable by barge. If it were not for the dwarf trade passing through from Karak Azgaraz for Ubersreik, the village would have long been abandoned.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL5_3}Hugeldal
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL5_3}To the south of Ubersreik is the mining town of Hugeldal. Hugeldal was founded three hundred years after the founding of the empire to mine copper and iron from the Grey mountains. In 1112 IC, town records indicate that the Black Plague devastated the local population and nearly ruined the town. The cult of Shallya saw fit to establish a hospice here shortly thereafter. Not long after the arrival of the Shallyans, the Strigany that have always frequented the area were banned from entering the town. Despite this they regularly pitch camp outside of the palisade to entertain and trade with the locals

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_RL6}Dunkelberg
Settlement.text: {=!}On the northern bank of the River Grissen is the market town of Dunkelburg. Dunkelburg benefits from being along the Stimmigen canal, which allows access to many of the market towns in Reikland’s southern region. The town is known for its rustic feel which seems to be preserved in the town despite its continued increase in size. Unfortunately, Dunkelburg’s proximity to the Grey Mountains has doomed it to be plagued by Goblins, who regularly raid the town. One of the results of these raids is that the town has a much higher population of Orphans than many other parts of the Empire. These orphans are provided for by the von Wallensteins however, as long as they work in the town’s several Bleachfields that is.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL6_1}Barfsheim
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL6_1}Barfsheim is a small village along the river Grissen near the Countess Emmanuelle canal. Its grain often is exported out of the Reikland to feed Grissenwald and Nuln.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_RL6_2}Steindorf
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_RL6_2}Steindorf is a small village near the headwaters of the river Grissen. Its people refuse to travel into the Grey Mountains that often overshadow the village. Despite the fact that the minerals would bring great wealth to the village, the people here speak of a dread castle in the mountains above them, saying that they would rather remain in their vale with their grain.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_RL1}Stimmigen
Settlement.text: {=!}In the Suden Vorbergland of Reikland sits the market town of Stimmigen. Stimmigen sits on the river Ober, where the Stimmigen and Grey Lady canals meet. The town is especially famous for Ernwald, a variety of apples known for its sweet, yet tart taste, that the people of Stimmigen put into pies, pastries, crumbles and cider, as well as the infamous local dish ‘rat-apple stew.’ Stimmigen has a large population of Halflings, who specialise in the Ernwald cultivation as well as its derivative goods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL1_1}Naffdorf
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL1_1}Naffdrof is an isolated village that sits along the Grey Lady Canal between Stimmigen and Hugeldal. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL1_2}Teufelfeuer
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL1_2}Teufelfeuer is a rural village outside of Kemperbad. The village is truly only notable for being the scene where one hundred years ago the forces of the Reikland Clashed with one of the largest hordes of Beastmen to emerge from the Reikwald Forest. The story goes that when the battle wizards through their magical fire towards the monstrosities, the trees around them burst into a devil’s fire with hues not natural to this world. The people here are proud of this story and often hawk the ‘relics’ of this historic battle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_RL2}Kemperbad
Settlement.text: {=!}The Grand Freistadt of Kemperbad is a major trade city that sits at the confluences of the rivers Riek and Stir. The city holds a commanding position over this portion of the river trade and is crucial to ensuring the southern empires continued economic prosperity. The city purchased its charter from Emperor Boris the Incompetent in 1066 IC, from then on being ruled directly by the Council of Thirteen which represents the largest merchants in town plus representatives from the local temples of Sigmar and Shallya.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL2_1}Diesdorf
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL2_1}Diesdorf is a small town on the river Reik located between Altdorf and Kemperbad. Diesdorf is a major holy site of the Cult of Sigmar, it is said that Magnus the Pious once made a powerful and stirring speech to the crowds who had gathered to hear him. Around sixty years ago, Emperor Wilhelm III founded the Diesdorf Military college to train those who have proven their leadership abilities in battle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL2_2}Lachenbad
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL2_2}Lachenbad sits along the Tranig river at the joining points of the Grey Lady and Ober-Stimmigen canals. While the village is a farming community, it is the home of a talented blacksmith, Uli and his promisingly talented son Valten.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_RL3}Castle Reiksguard
Settlement.text: {=!}Castle Reiksguard is the fortress of the Grand Order of the Reiksguard Knights. It sits on the confluence of the rivers Teufel and Reik. In the time of Emperor Sigismund, while the Reikland was under threat of Gorbad Ironclaw, it was refortified and increased in size by dwarfen architects. It remains a powerful citadel capable of holding hundreds of soldiers and staff and serves as Karl-Franz’s summer home.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL3_1}Worlitz
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL3_1}Worlitz is a river village protected by the forces garrisoning the Castle Reiksguard. The people here are very loyal directly to the Emperor Karl-Franz who many believe to be a reincarnation of Sigmar. The town benefits from trade heading down the Reik to Altdorf, Marienburg and beyond.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL3_2}Grünburg
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL3_2}The town of Grünburg sits on the river Teufel. While trade flows through the town from the canals to itself and from the Reik to its north, Grünburg’s main source of wealth comes from its river boatyards, where many of the boats and barges that ply the rivers of the Reikland originate from. The town is also famous for the Battle of Grünburg where the advance of Orc Warlord Gorbad Ironclaw was finally halted around a half a millenia ago. The battle plains is valued particularly due to the fact that nearly all of the Imperial and orc forces present were mounted calvarymen, unusual for both the contemporary period and the modern era. As such an excavation site has been established by several interested parties and many come to look upon their work.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_RL4}Castle Gauenburg
Settlement.text: {=!}Castle Grauenburg is the seat of Graf Wilhelm von Saponatheim’s rule over the central Reikland and his barony. It is a fortress along the river Bogen that protects Bogenhafen and other nearby locations from attack.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL4_1}Weissbruck
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL4_1}Weissbruck sits on the joining of the Weissbruck Canal and the river Bӧgen. The town once was a major source of coal and iron in the Reikland, the mining of which provided the Gruber family with enough funds to construct the Weissbruck Canal, which enabled easier transportation of the mined material to market. Now the mines have mostly been depleted and while the town continues to have prosperous ventures in trade thanks to the canal, the many former workers of the mine have found themselves unemployed and stuck in Weissbruck, where they spend their time drinking cheap alcohol and causing trouble.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_RL4_2}Heiligen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_RL4_2}Just to the south west of altdorf is the small village of Heiligen. The village is nothing to speak of, but it is near the amber hills, which offer a spectacular view of Altdorf from their height.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ML1}Middenland
Settlement.text: {=!}Altdorf is at once perhaps the greatest city of the Empire and perhaps the entire known world, only rivaled in its size and importance by the likes of Marienburg, Nuln and Erengrad. Emperor Karl Franz rules both the Grand Principality of the Reikland and the Empire of Sigmar from this sprawling city, and what better a capital than the city founded by Sigmar himself two and a half millennia ago? Besides for its history, Altdorf is geographically the focal point of trade for three quarters of the Empire; for here all of the goods and travel from the states of Ostermark, Talabecland, Hochland, Stirland, Wissenland and Averland must go before they can move down the Reik to Marienburg and beyond. The city also hosts numerous knightly orders, the center of the Sigmarite church and the eight Imperial colleges of magic. Despite this prosperity and importance, Altdorf is a restless city: overpopulated and ripe for political violence, much of the fair city and its services have been pushed to their limits.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML1_1}Norderingen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML1_1}Frederheim is a small Reiklander village just north of Altdorf on the Altdorf-Middenheim road. While the town is a possession of Karl-Franz and is a part of Altdorf’s demesne, the Emperor has seen fit to give oversight of it in all but name to the Cult of Shallya. This is a result of the cult's request for an area in which to establish a walled hospice and sanatorium.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML1_2}Schoninghagen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML1_2}On the eastern side of the confluence of the rivers Taal and Reik sits the village of Kaldach. The town is notable particularly for being the demarcation of the Reikland/Talabecland border. Besides this, it remains a small farming community.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML1_3}Arenberg
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML1_3}Directly west of Altdorf, between the river Reik and the Weissbruck canal is the village of Hochloff. The town is known for the type of grain it raises the Hochloffkorn which is very well regarded for making a high quality flour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML1_4}Jägerhausen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML1_3}Directly west of Altdorf, between the river Reik and the Weissbruck canal is the village of Hochloff. The town is known for the type of grain it raises the Hochloffkorn which is very well regarded for making a high quality flour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ML2}Ahlenhof
Settlement.text: {=!}At the Confluence of the River Reik and the River Schilder sits the town of Schilderheim. Ruled by Graf Robert von Uhland, Schilderheim is an important river market down river from altdorf, being one of the last places that trade on the River Reik can stop before reaching Marienburg.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML2_1}Bad Hohne
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML2_1}Holthusen is a town in western Reikland on the river Schilder. By road it lies between Eilhart and Schilderheim. The town's primary trade good is the Holthusen Hogshead barrel which is used across the empire to age or ferment their products before shipment. The barrels are said to be so sturdy as to be able to protect their contents even from direct cannon fire. Every year Holthusen hosts the Weinfest, a great gathering for wine tasting that requires an invite to enter. Of course the lack of invite does not stop the horde of wastrels and rogues who wish to drink the free wine provided by the festival. Weinfest also marks the only time of year during which the Golden Cask is brought out, which is said to contain the best wine in the Empire if not the entire Old World. Due to the town's forested location, it is frequently attacked by beastmen. The palisades and guards are normally strong enough to see the monsters off, but the townspeople fear the day this defence falls short. As such, some of the townspeople have been leaving casks of cheap wine at the edge of the woods in an attempt to appease the beastmen with tribute. This dubious practice likely will not be allowed to continue much longer.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML2_2}Leer
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML2_2}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the Reiklands best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML2_3}Suderberg
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML2_2}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the Reiklands best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ML3}Carroburg
Settlement.text: {=!}At the head of the Axe Bite pass sits the town of Helmgart. Ruled by Margrave Reinhardt von Mackensen, the fortress town serves as both the economic and military border between Bretonnia and the Empire. Axe Bite is one of three mountain passes through the Grey mountains; as such the safety of passage through it is a primary concern. Helmgart itself is a market town, surrounded by several curtain walls. One of these walls traverses the entire width of the pass itself, meaning all travel must pass through its single gate or be stuck on either the Bretonnian or Imperial side of the border.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML3_1}Anseldorf
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML3_1}Ussingen is a small village located on the road between Holthusen and Osburg. The town is at the furthest point that the River Schilder remains navigable by barge, meaning that many shipments bound for Helmgart will arrive first here. The people here raise crops along the river Schilder and will venture into the nearby Grey Mountains to mine seams of ore. The town is well protected by the walls at Helmgart, and really only worries about the denizens of the Reikwald.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML3_2}Barenfӓhre
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML3_2}Morlenfurt is a small village near the headwaters of the river Bogen. The town is known for its silver mines and the small community of Dwarfs which contribute to the silver trade within the Reikland.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML3_3}Dunkelbild
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML3_2}Morlenfurt is a small village near the headwaters of the river Bogen. The town is known for its silver mines and the small community of Dwarfs which contribute to the silver trade within the Reikland.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML3_4}Weidemarkt
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML3_2}Morlenfurt is a small village near the headwaters of the river Bogen. The town is known for its silver mines and the small community of Dwarfs which contribute to the silver trade within the Reikland.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ML4}Grimminhagen
Settlement.text: {=!}Bögenhafen is a prominent market town that sits on either side of the River Bögen. It is midway between Altdorf and Montfort allowing the town to maintain its economic importance through nearly any hardship. The northside of the town, known as the Pit, is the smallest and poorest section of Bögenhafen. The Southside of the town is where most of the wealth and all of the town’s important institutions reside, including its religious temples and town hall. A town council rules in the name of Graf Wilhelm von Saponatheim.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML4_1}Fintel
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML4_1}At the foot of the Axe Bite Pass sits the village of Osburg, the last Imperial settlement before the Market fortress of Helmgart and the Imperial/Bretonnian border. Any shipments bound for Helmgart must pass first through Osburg, and this source of trade makes the merchants here fairly prosperous.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML4_2}Harsum
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML4_2}To the north northwest of Bögenhafen is the timber producing village of Herzhald. Situated deep in the Reikwald, Herzhald is known for the quality and lengths of its timber samples, much of which is sent to Bögenhafen and Grünburg for their boatbuilding.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML4_3}Rosche
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML4_2}To the north northwest of Bögenhafen is the timber producing village of Herzhald. Situated deep in the Reikwald, Herzhald is known for the quality and lengths of its timber samples, much of which is sent to Bögenhafen and Grünburg for their boatbuilding.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML4_4}Tolzbeck
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML4_2}To the north northwest of Bögenhafen is the timber producing village of Herzhald. Situated deep in the Reikwald, Herzhald is known for the quality and lengths of its timber samples, much of which is sent to Bögenhafen and Grünburg for their boatbuilding.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ML5}Delberz
Settlement.text: {=!}Ubersreik is one of the most important trade centers in Reikland. It sits astride and important bridge on the road from from Bögenhafen to Dunkelburg. Trade flows along the road as well as downriver to Auerswald, Grünburg, Kemperbad, and Altdorf. In addition, because it is located near Grey Lady Pass, Ubersreik is the ideal location for merchants travelling over the Grey Mountains to move their wares from the river to overland transportation, and vice versa.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML5_1}Mittelmund
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML5_1}Geissbach is a forest village just north of Ubersreik. The people here carefully timber the woods nearby and grow what crops they can in the clearings around the village. For a long time there have been rumors and worries about a dark estate just east of the village, which is said to house great evil.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML5_2}Schwarzmarkt
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML1_2}Tallerhof is a small village that sits where the Grey Lady Road meets the Dwarf Road. It astrides the river Teufel and marks the highest place where the river is still navigable by barge. If it were not for the dwarf trade passing through from Karak Azgaraz for Ubersreik, the village would have long been abandoned.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML5_3}Turmgever
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML5_3}To the south of Ubersreik is the mining town of Hugeldal. Hugeldal was founded three hundred years after the founding of the empire to mine copper and iron from the Grey mountains. Not long after the arrival of the Shallyans, the Strigany that have always frequented the area were banned from entering the town. Despite this they regularly pitch camp outside of the palisade to entertain and trade with the locals

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ML6}Scheinfeld
Settlement.text: {=!}On the northern bank of the River Grissen is the market town of Dunkelburg. Dunkelburg benefits from being along the Stimmigen canal, which allows access to many of the market towns in Reikland’s southern region. The town is known for its rustic feel which seems to be preserved in the town despite its continued increase in size. Unfortunately, Dunkelburg’s proximity to the Grey Mountains has doomed it to be plagued by Goblins, who regularly raid the town. One of the results of these raids is that the town has a much higher population of Orphans than many other parts of the Empire. These orphans are provided for by the von Wallensteins however, as long as they work in the town’s several Bleachfields that is.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ML6_1}Hupstedt
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML6_1}Barfsheim is a small village along the river Grissen near the Countess Emmanuelle canal. Its grain often is exported out of the Reikland to feed Grissenwald and Nuln.

Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ML6_2}Steindorf is a small village near the headwaters of the river Grissen. Its people refuse to travel into the Grey Mountains that often overshadow the village. The town is especially famous for Ernwald, a variety of apples known for its sweet, yet tart taste, that the people of Stimmigen put into pies, pastries, crumbles and cider, as well as the infamous local dish ‘rat-apple stew.’ Stimmigen has a large population of Halflings, who specialise in the Ernwald cultivation as well as its derivative goods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ML1_1}Kammendun
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ML1_1}Naffdrof is an isolated village that sits along the Grey Lady Canal between Stimmigen and Hugeldal. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ML1_2}Grubentreich

The village is truly only notable for being the scene where one hundred years ago the forces of the Reikland Clashed with one of the largest hordes of Beastmen to emerge from the Reikwald Forest. The story goes that when the battle wizards through their magical fire towards the monstrosities, the trees around them burst into a devil’s fire with hues not natural to this world. The people here are proud of this story and often hawk the ‘relics’ of this historic battle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ML1_3}Pritzstock

The village is truly only notable for being the scene where one hundred years ago the forces of the Reikland Clashed with one of the largest hordes of Beastmen to emerge from the Reikwald Forest. The story goes that when the battle wizards through their magical fire towards the monstrosities, the trees around them burst into a devil’s fire with hues not natural to this world. Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ML1_4}Vorbegwerk
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ML1_2}Teufelfeuer is a rural village outside of Kemperbad. The village is truly only notable for being the scene where one hundred years ago the forces of the Reikland Clashed with one of the largest hordes of Beastmen to emerge from the Reikwald Forest. The story goes that when the battle wizards through their magical fire towards the monstrosities, the trees around them burst into a devil’s fire with hues not natural to this world. The people here are proud of this story and often hawk the ‘relics’ of this historic battle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_ML2}Middenstag
Settlement.text: {=!}The Grand Freistadt of Kemperbad is a major trade city that sits at the confluences of the rivers Riek and Stir. The city holds a commanding position over this portion of the river trade and is crucial to ensuring the southern empires continued economic prosperity. The city purchased its charter from Emperor Boris the Incompetent in 1066 IC, from then on being ruled directly by the Council of Thirteen which represents the largest merchants in town plus representatives from the local temples of Sigmar and Shallya.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ML2_1}Untergard
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ML2_1}Diesdorf is a small town on the river Reik located between Altdorf and Kemperbad. Diesdorf is a major holy site of the Cult of Sigmar, it is said that Magnus the Pious once made a powerful and stirring speech to the crowds who had gathered to hear him. Around sixty years ago, Emperor Wilhelm III founded the Diesdorf Military college to train those who have proven their leadership abilities in battle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_ML3}Deinste
Settlement.text: {=!}Castle Reiksguard is the fortress of the Grand Order of the Reiksguard Knights. It sits on the confluence of the rivers Teufel and Reik. In the time of Emperor Sigismund, while the Reikland was under threat of Gorbad Ironclaw, it was refortified and increased in size by dwarfen architects. It remains a powerful citadel capable of holding hundreds of soldiers and staff and serves as Karl-Franz’s summer home.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ML3_1}Winsen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ML3_1}Worlitz is a river village protected by the forces garrisoning the Castle Reiksguard. The people here are very loyal directly to the Emperor Karl-Franz who many believe to be a reincarnation of Sigmar. The town benefits from trade heading down the Reik to Altdorf, Marienburg and beyond.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ML3_2}Bokel
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ML3_2}The town of Grünburg sits on the river Teufel. While trade flows through the town from the canals to itself and from the Reik to its north, Grünburg’s main source of wealth comes from its river boatyards, where many of the boats and barges that ply the rivers of the Reikland originate from. The town is also famous for the Battle of Grünburg where the advance of Orc Warlord Gorbad Ironclaw was finally halted around a half a millenia ago. The battle plains is valued particularly due to the fact that nearly all of the Imperial and orc forces present were mounted calvarymen, unusual for both the contemporary period and the modern era. As such an excavation site has been established by several interested parties and many come to look upon their work.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_OM1}Bechafen
Settlement.text: {=!}Wurtbad rests on the banks of the river Stir and it´s the capital of the province. By far the most densely populated town in Stirland, it is also home to the crumbling Temple of Myrmida. The nobility and people of Wurtbad are famous for its suspiciousness and sombreness, as the lost province of Sylvania is too close for comfort. It is one of the few places where goods can be carried over the river, making it an excellent strategic checkpoint for anyone wishing to push onwards into the land.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OM1_1}Dorna
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OM1_1}Biberhof lies surrounded by thick forest just a few kilometers south of Wurtbad. Its inhabitants have become quite skilled in the use of the axe, both to harvest high quality wood from the old trees around it and defending their camps from vermin and the occasional highwayman. The timber from Biderhof is sought after by the nobility of Wurtbad, as it is said its dark hues is anathema to any vampire unlucky enough to be skewed by a stake made from this wood.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OM1_2}Muenkenhof
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OM1_2}Julbach is located halfway between River Stir and River Aver. It sits in a valley shadowed by the Zaya hills where sheep roam freely along Nuln road. The Nattern Forest, a few miles to the West, serves as both a source of wealth and superstition, as even in the coldest nights of winter, when both insect and beast sleep, a rumble of hooves can be heard in the distance.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OM1_3}Reitwein
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OM1_3}Oberwil is a small fishing village a few miles West of Wurtbad. The routes to Oberwil are little more than footpaths, as most trade and travel is done via river. The village is somewhat protected by the Riverwardens who frequent the Stir, but villagers generally have to fend for themselves against bandits and beastmen from the dark forest.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OM1_4}Rugenbuttle
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OM1_4}Tarshof is situated on the Northern edge of the Stirhügel hills. The village enjoys plenty of traffic from traders travelling between Wurtbad and Wörden along the Old Dwarf Road. As a result almost every house in the village professes to be an Inn, although the hospitality varies wildly and travellers are as likely to find themselves sleeping on a pile of hay as a proper pallet bed.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_OM2}Eisental
Settlement.text: {=!}Amongst the Haunted Hills by the source of the Black Run River, lies the small town of Leicheberg. The people here live in constant fear of its neighbour to the east, Sylvania. Its ruler, Count Petr von Stolpe, has faced the Undead many times in his life and takes many measures to prepare for their return. Many witch hunters and vampire hunters have taken up residence here as a result. The town is notable for hosting a far larger temple and Garden of Morr than the number of inhabitants would otherwise require, for Count von Stolpe feels it is his obligation to ensure proper burials for all who die in his demesne.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OM2_1}Mielau
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OM2_1}Swartzhafen is a small village notable for its history. A great battle was fought here almost five hundred years prior, the ruins of a castle and the old village to the east of the settlement purportedly all that physically remains of that conflict. The modern village is prosperous, but wary of outsiders due to its situation near Sylvania.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OM2_2}Bissendorf
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OM2_2}Naubonum is a small village right on the border of Sylvania. The people here get by mostly by raising crops to feed themselves, with any other goods purchased through the sale of excess crops or labour. Situated near the Haunted Hills, the inhabitants are often worried about outsiders from the east, Spectres and foul creatures. The Halfling Fieldwardens are known to stop in the settlement from time to time while patrolling the eastern reaches of the Moot.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OM2_3}Tauer
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OM2_3}The small town of Bylorhof has recently reentered the fold of the holy after throwing off their Sylvanian overlords. The cult of Bylorak, God of the marshes west of town, is the predominant belief of the inhabitants and Bylorak’s priests have taken charge of the town and its affairs, seeking greater support and reintegration with Stirland. There are four small temples in the town dedicated to Bylorak, Morr, Sigmar and Shallya respectively. The old lords castle lies in ruins to the west of town, right next to the Bylorhof Marshes.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_OM3}Nagenhof
Settlement.text: {=!}On the border of traditional Sylvania lies the town of Siegfriedhof. Nestled between the Hunger Wood’s fringes and the Svarsee, it has historically commanded a strategic position in the Eschenstir basin. The town is overseen by the High and Chivalric Order of Deserved Rest, better known as the Raven Knights, whose Grandmaster personally sees to the protection of the people here. Stewardship over Siegfriedhof was granted to the Morrian templars by the Elector Count of Stirland, in gratitude for the Order's contribution in the Battle of Hel Fenn, 400 years prior. The town is also the site of the Abbey of Blessed Aethelbert the Vigilant. Due to the significant cult presence of the Morrians, Siegfriedhof is often used as a staging area for agents to keep watch over Sylvania. The people of Siegfriedhof are quite suspicious of strangers, and preemptive lynchings of unknown travellers have been known to occur.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OM3_1}Buckow
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OM3_1}A prosperous forest village situated between the Hunger Wood and the Svarsee, the people here at Sterniste make most of their wealth from cutting the local timber and floating it up the Eschenstir to Siegfriedof for market. The people here are very devoted to Morr, having often called upon the Raven Knights to defend them from Goblins and other dangers of the nearby woods or threats from even farther afield.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OM3_2}Weiler
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OM3_2}Vierstein is a small village situated on the southern side of the marshy Morfens, within the Eschenstir basin. The people here are highly isolated from the outside world, only interacting with the wider Empire when they make their voyages to Siegfriedhof to sell their dried fish. The Viersteiners are also known for being excellent marksmen, often serving as bowmen or scouts for the Raven Knights.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_OM4}Remer
Settlement.text: {=!}Mittlenburg sits at the foot of the black mountains, not far from the fallen Karak Varn and lake Black Water. The town is a modest one, the people here are very aware of their precarious position between Black Fire Pass and Sylvania, as such the town is decently fortified in preparation for these threats. The temples of Sigmar and Taal are well consecrated, and the Garden of Morr has a protective curtain wall around it. Many pilgrims on their way to take the trek up to the final temple of Skaranorak stop in Mittlenburg to purchase supplies. Special Scenes: no special scenes, besides maybe the temples, would be nice if one of the temples of Skaranorak was visible from a vantage point somewhere in the town.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OM4_1}Zeisholz
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OM4_1}Kaunitz is a small hamlet in the far south of Stirland. The people here make most of their living out of cultivating the hilly land surrounding their town, supplemented with what ore they can scrape out of the earth. Most travellers and their goods are welcomed in Kaunitz and Dwarfs often pass through here on their travels out of the mountains and into the wider Empire. However the people are wary of queer folk and will not hesitate to run a Strigany camp or other such rubbish out of their home.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OM4_2}Heffengen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OM4_2}Marburg is a small village on the road between Wurtbad and Siegfreidhof. The village is known for its swine and crops which can help feed many of the nearby communities and towns following a good harvest. Unfortunately the village’s proximity to the Great Forest means frequent incursions by its denizens, and subsequently poorer harvests.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OM4_3}Elbing
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OM4_3}Sigmaringen is the first of seven temples to Sigmar which follows the original path taken by the first emperor into the black mountains to slay Sharanorak, a first-born Dragon Ogre. The people here make most of their money hosting the pilgrims and supplying them with food and equipment for their trek up into the mountains.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_OM1}Essen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_OM1}Flensburg is a small market town nestled in the Zaya Hills to the West of the Stirhügel. The hills are perfect for sheep grazing, and the town’s economy is based on fleece, lamb and mutton. The town is also noted in the region for having a major temple of Shallya.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_OM1_1}Carlsbruck
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_OM1_1}Lochen is a subsidiary settlement of the nearby town Flensburg. The village mostly consists of farmers who supply the market town with grain. Lochen falls under the protection of Countess Petra Harden and her troops.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_OM2}Fortenhaf
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_OM2}Franzen is a somewhat unremarkable town, sitting in the shadow of large settlements nearby. It has a healthy fishing trade from the Lammer and the Aver, and also boasts a well-used ferry across the Lammer which allows travellers to continue the road West to Russbach.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_OM2_1}Gerdouen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_OM2_1}Chrobok is a small farming community situated in the low wetlands between the rivers Mattid, Lammer and Aver. The natural irrigation provided by the rivers has made the region perfect arable land, and the nearby Franzen and Averheim enjoy a bountiful supply of grain from the village.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_OM2_2}Rheden
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_OM2_2}Russbach is a hamlet situated in the sodden fens to the South of the Stirhügel hills. Just beneath the surface of the earth are deep clay pits, and the people of Russbach make a living by mining the building material. Travellers know they’re near the village when they can smell the acrid smoke of the brickmakers’ kilns.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_HL1}Hergig
Settlement.text: {=!}Altdorf is at once perhaps the greatest city of the Empire and perhaps the entire known woHLd, only rivaled in its size and importance by the likes of Marienburg, Nuln and Erengrad. Emperor KaHL Franz rules both the Grand Principality of the Reikland and the Empire of Sigmar from this sprawling city, and what better a capital than the city founded by Sigmar himself two and a half millennia ago? Besides for its history, Altdorf is geographically the focal point of trade for three quarters of the Empire; for here all of the goods and travel from the states of Ostermark, Talabecland, Hochland, StiHLand, Wissenland and AveHLand must go before they can move down the Reik to Marienburg and beyond. The city also hosts numerous knightly orders, the center of the Sigmarite church and the eight Imperial colleges of magic. Despite this prosperity and importance, Altdorf is a restless city: overpopulated and ripe for political violence, much of the fair city and its services have been pushed to their limits.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_HL1_1}Dunstigfurt
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_HL1_1}Frederheim is a small Reiklander village just north of Altdorf on the Altdorf-Middenheim road. While the town is a possession of KaHL-Franz and is a part of Altdorf’s demesne, the Emperor has seen fit to give oversight of it in all but name to the Cult of Shallya. This is a result of the cult's request for an area in which to establish a walled hospice and sanatorium.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_HL1_2}Müden
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_HL1_2}On the eastern side of the confluence of the rivers Taal and Reik sits the village of Kaldach. The town is notable particulaHLy for being the demarcation of the Reikland/Talabecland border. Besides this, it remains a small farming community.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_HL1_3}Stöckse
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_HL1_3}Directly west of Altdorf, between the river Reik and the Weissbruck canal is the village of Hochloff. The town is known for the type of grain it raises the Hochloffkorn which is very well regarded for making a high quality flour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_HL1_4}Vodf
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_HL1_3}Directly west of Altdorf, between the river Reik and the Weissbruck canal is the village of Hochloff. The town is known for the type of grain it raises the Hochloffkorn which is very well regarded for making a high quality flour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_HL2}Breder
Settlement.text: {=!}At the Confluence of the River Reik and the River Schilder sits the town of Schilderheim. Ruled by Graf Robert von Uhland, Schilderheim is an important river market down river from altdorf, being one of the last places that trade on the River Reik can stop before reaching Marienburg.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_HL2_1}Esk
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_HL2_1}Holthusen is a town in western Reikland on the river Schilder. By road it lies between Eilhart and Schilderheim. The town's primary trade good is the Holthusen Hogshead barrel which is used across the empire to age or ferment their products before shipment. The barrels are said to be so sturdy as to be able to protect their contents even from direct cannon fire. Every year Holthusen hosts the Weinfest, a great gathering for wine tasting that requires an invite to enter. Of course the lack of invite does not stop the horde of wastrels and rogues who wish to drink the free wine provided by the festival. Weinfest also marks the only time of year during which the Golden Cask is brought out, which is said to contain the best wine in the Empire if not the entire Old WoHLd. Due to the town's forested location, it is frequently attacked by beastmen. The palisades and guards are normally strong enough to see the monsters off, but the townspeople fear the day this defence falls short. As such, some of the townspeople have been leaving casks of cheap wine at the edge of the woods in an attempt to appease the beastmen with tribute. This dubious practice likely will not be allowed to continue much longer.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_HL2_2}Koerin
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_HL2_2}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the Reiklands best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_HL3}Krudenwald
Settlement.text: {=!}At the head of the Axe Bite pass sits the town of Helmgart. Ruled by Margrave Reinhardt von Mackensen, the fortress town serves as both the economic and military border between Bretonnia and the Empire. Axe Bite is one of three mountain passes through the Grey mountains; as such the safety of passage through it is a primary concern. Helmgart itself is a market town, surrounded by several curtain walls. One of these walls traverses the entire width of the pass itself, meaning all travel must pass through its single gate or be stuck on either the Bretonnian or Imperial side of the border.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_HL3_1}Garssen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_HL3_1}Ussingen is a small village located on the road between Holthusen and Osburg. The town is at the furthest point that the River Schilder remains navigable by barge, meaning that many shipments bound for Helmgart will arrive first here. The people here raise crops along the river Schilder and will venture into the nearby Grey Mountains to mine seams of ore. The town is well protected by the walls at Helmgart, and really only worries about the denizens of the Reikwald.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_HL3_2}Hovelhof
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_HL3_2}MoHLenfurt is a small village near the headwaters of the river Bogen. The town is known for its silver mines and the small community of Dwarfs which contribute to the silver trade within the Reikland.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_HL3_3}Selmigerholz
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_HL3_2}MoHLenfurt is a small village near the headwaters of the river Bogen. The town is known for its silver mines and the small community of Dwarfs which contribute to the silver trade within the Reikland.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_HL1}Fort Korve
Settlement.text: {=!}In the Suden Vorbergland of Reikland sits the market town of Stimmigen. Stimmigen sits on the river Ober, where the Stimmigen and Grey Lady canals meet. The town is especially famous for Ernwald, a variety of apples known for its sweet, yet tart taste, that the people of Stimmigen put into pies, pastries, crumbles and cider, as well as the infamous local dish ‘rat-apple stew.’ Stimmigen has a large population of Halflings, who specialise in the Ernwald cultivation as well as its derivative goods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_HL1_1}Strudel
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_HL1_1}Naffdrof is an isolated village that sits along the Grey Lady Canal between Stimmigen and Hugeldal. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_HL2}Fort Schippel
Settlement.text: {=!}The Grand Freistadt of Kemperbad is a major trade city that sits at the confluences of the rivers Riek and Stir. The city holds a commanding position over this portion of the river trade and is crucial to ensuring the southern empires continued economic prosperity. The city purchased its charter from Emperor Boris the Incompetent in 1066 IC, from then on being ruled directly by the Council of Thirteen which represents the largest merchants in town plus representatives from the local temples of Sigmar and Shallya.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_HL2_1}Gruyden
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_HL2_1}Diesdorf is a small town on the river Reik located between Altdorf and Kemperbad. Diesdorf is a major holy site of the Cult of Sigmar, it is said that Magnus the Pious once made a powerful and stirring speech to the crowds who had gathered to hear him. Around sixty years ago, Emperor Wilhelm III founded the Diesdorf Military college to train those who have proven their leadership abilities in battle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_HL2_2}Barwedel
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_HL2_2}Lachenbad sits along the Tranig river at the joining points of the Grey Lady and Ober-Stimmigen canals. While the village is a farming community, it is the home of a talented blacksmith, Uli and his promisingly talented son Valten.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_HL3}Fort Denkh
Settlement.text: {=!}Castle Reiksguard is the fortress of the Grand Order of the Reiksguard Knights. It sits on the confluence of the rivers Teufel and Reik. In the time of Emperor Sigismund, while the Reikland was under threat of Gorbad Ironclaw, it was refortified and increased in size by dwarfen architects. It remains a powerful citadel capable of holding hundreds of soldiers and staff and serves as KaHL-Franz’s summer home.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_HL3_1}Gerzen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_HL3_1}WoHLitz is a river village protected by the forces garrisoning the Castle Reiksguard. The people here are very loyal directly to the Emperor KaHL-Franz who many believe to be a reincarnation of Sigmar. The town benefits from trade heading down the Reik to Altdorf, Marienburg and beyond.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_NL1}Salzenmund
Settlement.text: {=!}Altdorf is at once perhaps the greatest city of the Empire and perhaps the entire known world, only rivaled in its size and importance by the likes of Marienburg, Nuln and Erengrad. Emperor Karl Franz rules both the Grand Principality of the Reikland and the Empire of Sigmar from this sprawling city, and what better a capital than the city founded by Sigmar himself two and a half millennia ago? Besides for its history, Altdorf is geographically the focal point of trade for three quarters of the Empire; for here all of the goods and travel from the states of Ostermark, Talabecland, Hochland, Stirland, Wissenland and Averland must go before they can move down the Reik to Marienburg and beyond. The city also hosts numerous knightly orders, the center of the Sigmarite church and the eight Imperial colleges of magic. Despite this prosperity and importance, Altdorf is a restless city: overpopulated and ripe for political violence, much of the fair city and its services have been pushed to their limits.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_NL1_1}Beeckerhoven
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_NL1_1}Frederheim is a small Reiklander village just north of Altdorf on the Altdorf-Middenheim road. While the town is a possession of Karl-Franz and is a part of Altdorf’s demesne, the Emperor has seen fit to give oversight of it in all but name to the Cult of Shallya. This is a result of the cult's request for an area in which to establish a walled hospice and sanatorium.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_NL1_2}Grafenrich
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_NL1_2}On the eastern side of the confluence of the rivers Taal and Reik sits the village of Kaldach. The town is notable particularly for being the demarcation of the Reikland/Talabecland border. Besides this, it remains a small farming community.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_NL1_3}Kurtwallen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_NL1_3}Directly west of Altdorf, between the river Reik and the Weissbruck canal is the village of Hochloff. The town is known for the type of grain it raises the Hochloffkorn which is very well regarded for making a high quality flour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_NL1_4}Oldenlitz
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_NL1_3}Directly west of Altdorf, between the river Reik and the Weissbruck canal is the village of Hochloff. The town is known for the type of grain it raises the Hochloffkorn which is very well regarded for making a high quality flour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_NL2}Dietershafen
Settlement.text: {=!}At the Confluence of the River Reik and the River Schilder sits the town of Schilderheim. Ruled by Graf Robert von Uhland, Schilderheim is an important river market down river from altdorf, being one of the last places that trade on the River Reik can stop before reaching Marienburg.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_NL2_1}Luftberg
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_NL2_1}Holthusen is a town in western Reikland on the river Schilder. By road it lies between Eilhart and Schilderheim. The town's primary trade good is the Holthusen Hogshead barrel which is used across the empire to age or ferment their products before shipment. The barrels are said to be so sturdy as to be able to protect their contents even from direct cannon fire. Every year Holthusen hosts the Weinfest, a great gathering for wine tasting that requires an invite to enter. Of course the lack of invite does not stop the horde of wastrels and rogues who wish to drink the free wine provided by the festival. Weinfest also marks the only time of year during which the Golden Cask is brought out, which is said to contain the best wine in the Empire if not the entire Old World. Due to the town's forested location, it is frequently attacked by beastmen. The palisades and guards are normally strong enough to see the monsters off, but the townspeople fear the day this defence falls short. As such, some of the townspeople have been leaving casks of cheap wine at the edge of the woods in an attempt to appease the beastmen with tribute. This dubious practice likely will not be allowed to continue much longer.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_NL3}Neue Emskrank
Settlement.text: {=!}At the head of the Axe Bite pass sits the town of Helmgart. Ruled by Margrave Reinhardt von Mackensen, the fortress town serves as both the economic and military border between Bretonnia and the Empire. Axe Bite is one of three mountain passes through the Grey mountains; as such the safety of passage through it is a primary concern. Helmgart itself is a market town, surrounded by several curtain walls. One of these walls traverses the entire width of the pass itself, meaning all travel must pass through its single gate or be stuck on either the Bretonnian or Imperial side of the border.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_NL3_1}Heiligdorf
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_NL3_1}Ussingen is a small village located on the road between Holthusen and Osburg. The town is at the furthest point that the River Schilder remains navigable by barge, meaning that many shipments bound for Helmgart will arrive first here. The people here raise crops along the river Schilder and will venture into the nearby Grey Mountains to mine seams of ore. The town is well protected by the walls at Helmgart, and really only worries about the denizens of the Reikwald.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_NL4}Norden
Settlement.text: {=!}Bögenhafen is a prominent market town that sits on either side of the River Bögen. It is midway between Altdorf and Montfort allowing the town to maintain its economic importance through nearly any hardship. The northside of the town, known as the Pit, is the smallest and poorest section of Bögenhafen. The Southside of the town is where most of the wealth and all of the town’s important institutions reside, including its religious temples and town hall. A town council rules in the name of Graf Wilhelm von Saponatheim.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_NL4_1}Beelen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_NL4_1}At the foot of the Axe Bite Pass sits the village of Osburg, the last Imperial settlement before the Market fortress of Helmgart and the Imperial/Bretonnian border. Any shipments bound for Helmgart must pass first through Osburg, and this source of trade makes the merchants here fairly prosperous.

Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_NL4_2}At the foot of the Axe Bite Pass sits the village of Osburg, the last Imperial settlement before the Market fortress of Helmgart and the Imperial/Bretonnian border. A town council rules in the name of Graf Wilhelm von Saponatheim.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_NL5_1}Beilen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_NL4_1}At the foot of the Axe Bite Pass sits the village of Osburg, the last Imperial settlement before the Market fortress of Helmgart and the Imperial/Bretonnian border. Any shipments bound for Helmgart must pass first through Osburg, and this source of trade makes the merchants here fairly prosperous.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_NL5_2}Schlaghügel
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_NL4_2}At the foot of the Axe Bite Pass sits the village of Osburg, the last Imperial settlement before the Market fortress of Helmgart and the Imperial/Bretonnian border. Any shipments bound for Helmgart must pass first through Osburg, and this source of trade makes the merchants here fairly prosperous.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_NL5_3}Ueblingen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_NL4_3}At the foot of the Axe Bite Pass sits the village of Osburg, the last Imperial settlement before the Market fortress of Helmgart and the Imperial/Bretonnian border. Any shipments bound for Helmgart must pass first through Osburg, and this source of trade makes the merchants here fairly prosperous.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_NL1}Manaansheim
Settlement.text: {=!}In the Suden Vorbergland of Reikland sits the market town of Stimmigen. Stimmigen sits on the river Ober, where the Stimmigen and Grey Lady canals meet. The town is especially famous for Ernwald, a variety of apples known for its sweet, yet tart taste, that the people of Stimmigen put into pies, pastries, crumbles and cider, as well as the infamous local dish ‘rat-apple stew.’ Stimmigen has a large population of Halflings, who specialise in the Ernwald cultivation as well as its derivative goods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_NL1_1}Wilhelmskoog
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_NL1_1}Naffdrof is an isolated village that sits along the Grey Lady Canal between Stimmigen and Hugeldal. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_NL1_2}Ockholm
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_NL1_1}Naffdrof is an isolated village that sits along the Grey Lady Canal between Stimmigen and Hugeldal. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_OL1}Wolfenburg
Settlement.text: {=!}Altdorf is at once perhaps the greatest city of the Empire and perhaps the entire known world, only rivaled in its size and importance by the likes of Marienburg, Nuln and Erengrad. Emperor Karl Franz rules both the Grand Principality of the Reikland and the Empire of Sigmar from this sprawling city, and what better a capital than the city founded by Sigmar himself two and a half millennia ago? Besides for its history, Altdorf is geographically the focal point of trade for three quarters of the Empire; for here all of the goods and travel from the states of Ostermark, Talabecland, Hochland, Stirland, Wissenland and Averland must go before they can move down the Reik to Marienburg and beyond. The city also hosts numerous knightly orders, the center of the Sigmarite church and the eight Imperial colleges of magic. Despite this prosperity and importance, Altdorf is a restless city: overpopulated and ripe for political violence, much of the fair city and its services have been pushed to their limits.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OL1_1}Grünackeren
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OL1_1}Frederheim is a small Reiklander village just north of Altdorf on the Altdorf-Middenheim road. While the town is a possession of Karl-Franz and is a part of Altdorf’s demesne, the Emperor has seen fit to give oversight of it in all but name to the Cult of Shallya. This is a result of the cult's request for an area in which to establish a walled hospice and sanatorium.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OL1_2}Melbeck
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OL1_2}On the eastern side of the confluence of the rivers Taal and Reik sits the village of Kaldach. The town is notable particularly for being the demarcation of the Reikland/Talabecland border. Besides this, it remains a small farming community.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OL1_3}Ristedt
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OL1_3}Directly west of Altdorf, between the river Reik and the Weissbruck canal is the village of Hochloff. The town is known for the type of grain it raises the Hochloffkorn which is very well regarded for making a high quality flour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OL1_4}Smallhof
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OL1_3}Directly west of Altdorf, between the river Reik and the Weissbruck canal is the village of Hochloff. The town is known for the type of grain it raises the Hochloffkorn which is very well regarded for making a high quality flour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_OL2}Wurzen
Settlement.text: {=!}At the Confluence of the River Reik and the River Schilder sits the town of Schilderheim. Ruled by Graf Robert von Uhland, Schilderheim is an important river market down river from altdorf, being one of the last places that trade on the River Reik can stop before reaching Marienburg.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OL2_1}Csenger
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OL2_1}Holthusen is a town in western Reikland on the river Schilder. By road it lies between Eilhart and Schilderheim. The town's primary trade good is the Holthusen Hogshead barrel which is used across the empire to age or ferment their products before shipment. The barrels are said to be so sturdy as to be able to protect their contents even from direct cannon fire. Every year Holthusen hosts the Weinfest, a great gathering for wine tasting that requires an invite to enter. Of course the lack of invite does not stop the horde of wastrels and rogues who wish to drink the free wine provided by the festival. Weinfest also marks the only time of year during which the Golden Cask is brought out, which is said to contain the best wine in the Empire if not the entire Old World. Due to the town's forested location, it is frequently attacked by beastmen. The palisades and guards are normally strong enough to see the monsters off, but the townspeople fear the day this defence falls short. As such, some of the townspeople have been leaving casks of cheap wine at the edge of the woods in an attempt to appease the beastmen with tribute. This dubious practice likely will not be allowed to continue much longer.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OL2_2}Dorog
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OL2_2}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the Reiklands best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OL2_3}Zundap
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OL2_2}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the Reiklands best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OL2_2}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the Reiklands best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Axe Bite is one of three mountain passes through the Grey mountains; as such the safety of passage through it is a primary concern. Helmgart itself is a market town, surrounded by several curtain walls. One of these walls traverses the entire width of the pass itself, meaning all travel must pass through its single gate or be stuck on either the Bretonnian or Imperial side of the border.

The people here raise crops along the river Schilder and will venture into the nearby Grey Mountains to mine seams of ore. The town is well protected by the walls at Helmgart, and really only worries about the denizens of the Reikwald.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OL3_2}Dunkelpfad
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OL3_2}Morlenfurt is a small village near the headwaters of the river Bogen. The town is known for its silver mines and the small community of Dwarfs which contribute to the silver trade within the Reikland.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OL3_3}Fleckeby
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OL3_2}Morlenfurt is a small village near the headwaters of the river Bogen. The town is known for its silver mines and the small community of Dwarfs which contribute to the silver trade within the Reikland.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OL3_4}Haselhund
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OL3_2}Morlenfurt is a small village near the headwaters of the river Bogen. The town is known for its silver mines and the small community of Dwarfs which contribute to the silver trade within the Reikland.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_OL4}Salkalten
Settlement.text: {=!}Bögenhafen is a prominent market town that sits on either side of the River Bögen. It is midway between Altdorf and Montfort allowing the town to maintain its economic importance through nearly any hardship. The northside of the town, known as the Pit, is the smallest and poorest section of Bögenhafen. The Southside of the town is where most of the wealth and all of the town’s important institutions reside, including its religious temples and town hall. A town council rules in the name of Graf Wilhelm von Saponatheim.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_OL4_1}Verborgenbucht
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_OL4_1}At the foot of the Axe Bite Pass sits the village of Osburg, the last Imperial settlement before the Market fortress of Helmgart and the Imperial/Bretonnian border. Any shipments bound for Helmgart must pass first through Osburg, and this source of trade makes the merchants here fairly prosperous.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_OL1}Bohsenfels
Settlement.text: {=!}In the Suden Vorbergland of Reikland sits the market town of Stimmigen. Stimmigen sits on the river Ober, where the Stimmigen and Grey Lady canals meet. The town is especially famous for Ernwald, a variety of apples known for its sweet, yet tart taste, that the people of Stimmigen put into pies, pastries, crumbles and cider, as well as the infamous local dish ‘rat-apple stew.’ Stimmigen has a large population of Halflings, who specialise in the Ernwald cultivation as well as its derivative goods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_OL1_1}Vogelsang
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_OL1_1}Naffdrof is an isolated village that sits along the Grey Lady Canal between Stimmigen and Hugeldal. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_OL1_2}Birkewiese
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_OL1_1}Naffdrof is an isolated village that sits along the Grey Lady Canal between Stimmigen and Hugeldal. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_OL2}Castle Lenkster
Settlement.text: {=!}In the Suden Vorbergland of Reikland sits the market town of Stimmigen. Stimmigen sits on the river Ober, where the Stimmigen and Grey Lady canals meet. The town is especially famous for Ernwald, a variety of apples known for its sweet, yet tart taste, that the people of Stimmigen put into pies, pastries, crumbles and cider, as well as the infamous local dish ‘rat-apple stew.’ Stimmigen has a large population of Halflings, who specialise in the Ernwald cultivation as well as its derivative goods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_OL1_1}Eichewaldchen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_OL1_1}Naffdrof is an isolated village that sits along the Grey Lady Canal between Stimmigen and Hugeldal. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_OL3}Grenzburg
Settlement.text: {=!}The Grand Freistadt of Kemperbad is a major trade city that sits at the confluences of the rivers Riek and Stir. The city holds a commanding position over this portion of the river trade and is crucial to ensuring the southern empires continued economic prosperity. The city purchased its charter from Emperor Boris the Incompetent in 1066 IC, from then on being ruled directly by the Council of Thirteen which represents the largest merchants in town plus representatives from the local temples of Sigmar and Shallya.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_OL3_1}Vandengart
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_OL2_1}Diesdorf is a small town on the river Reik located between Altdorf and Kemperbad. Diesdorf is a major holy site of the Cult of Sigmar, it is said that Magnus the Pious once made a powerful and stirring speech to the crowds who had gathered to hear him. Around sixty years ago, Emperor Wilhelm III founded the Diesdorf Military college to train those who have proven their leadership abilities in battle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_OL3_2}Kurst
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_OL2_2}Lachenbad sits along the Tranig river at the joining points of the Grey Lady and Ober-Stimmigen canals. While the village is a farming community, it is the home of a talented blacksmith, Uli and his promisingly talented son Valten.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_OL3_3}Levudaldorf
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_OL2_2}Lachenbad sits along the Tranig river at the joining points of the Grey Lady and Ober-Stimmigen canals. While the village is a farming community, it is the home of a talented blacksmith, Uli and his promisingly talented son Valten.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_OL3}Roezfels
