Settlement.text: {=!}Castle Reiksguard is the fortress of the Grand Order of the Reiksguard Knights. It sits on the confluence of the rivers Teufel and Reik. In the time of Emperor Sigismund, while the Reikland was under threat of Gorbad Ironclaw, it was refortified and increased in size by dwarfen architects. It remains a powerful citadel capable of holding hundreds of soldiers and staff and serves as Karl-Franz’s summer home.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_OL4_1}Obelstein
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_OL3_1}Worlitz is a river village protected by the forces garrisoning the Castle Reiksguard. The people here are very loyal directly to the Emperor Karl-Franz who many believe to be a reincarnation of Sigmar. The town benefits from trade heading down the Reik to Altdorf, Marienburg and beyond.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BK2}Brass Keep
Settlement.text: {=!}Castle Reiksguard is the fortress of the Grand Order of the Reiksguard Knights. It sits on the confluence of the rivers Teufel and Reik. In the time of Emperor Sigismund, while the Reikland was under threat of Gorbad Ironclaw, it was refortified and increased in size by dwarfen architects. It remains a powerful citadel capable of holding hundreds of soldiers and staff and serves as Karl-Franz’s summer home.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_LL1}Tor Lithanel
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_LL1}The city of Parravon, built by the elves long ago, was cut from a lone mountain, Les Monts Seuls, and runs directly along the Grismerie river. Surrounded by deep chasms, it is a key fortress city in holding off any enemies from the Grey Mountains and beyond, from reaching central Bretonnia. Due to the location, many Dwarf families have flocked to Parravon. It is also notable for being the only place in Bretonnia where peasants can live in Stone houses. This is due to a trick of legal language; the homes the peasants carve out of the rock of Les Monts Seuls are considered ‘Caves’ and thus are not prohibited.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_LL1_1}Ystin Vaul Menluith Qhaysh
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_LL1_1}The village of Allobroges is a renowned settlement for its particular horse breeders, even among Paravon which sees use of mainly Pegusi. Allobroges has a fair population and sees many visits by Nobles and Travelers alike.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_LL1_2}Verdan Lithridrom
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_LL1_2}Not far from the Grey Mountains lies Gentiane, a small village with a main focus on Iron mining within the Grey Mountains. Heavily patrolled due to its strategic nature, Gentiane holds Paravon’s economy by the pillars.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_LL1_3}Fountain of Lebin
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_LL1_3}Near the Grey Lady Pass, Goyarde holds a decent size of villagers, and militia alike. Being the first village into Bretonnia from Grey Lady pass, it is quite defensible and strategic in nature.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_LL1}Tower of Se-Athil
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_LL1}Located on the border of Montfort, Castle Vingtiennes holds the northern province of Parravon from attack, and overlooks the river Grismerie and Massif Orcal.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_LL1_1}Sarrielrein
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_LL1_1} In the west of Parravon, near the borders of Montfort, Laval holds a tight knit relationship with its neighbour, Etoy. They often trade goods, such as raw materials for leather and hides. During the Lily Day, the two villages have many weddings and hold a small festival.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_LL1_2}Farisar's Rock
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_LL1_1} In the west of Parravon, near the borders of Montfort, Laval holds a tight knit relationship with its neighbour, Etoy. They often trade goods, such as raw materials for leather and hides. During the Lily Day, the two villages have many weddings and hold a small festival.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_LL2}Aroth Loren
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_MO2}Castle Chambonnay holds the southern border of Parravon from Quenelles, and is the first line of defence from attacks from the south of Bretonnia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_LL2_1}Kor Immarmor
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_LL2_1}Just south west of Castle Paravon lies the village of Lesevre, which hosts large deposits of Wood. Lesevre is very rich in wealth due to Castle Paravon needing coal to fuel the smithies for production of weapons and armour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_LL2}Aroth Hanor
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_MO2}Castle Chambonnay holds the southern border of Parravon from Quenelles, and is the first line of defence from attacks from the south of Bretonnia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_LL3_1}Lathain
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_LL3_1}Just south west of Castle Paravon lies the village of Lesevre, which hosts large deposits of Wood. Lesevre is very rich in wealth due to Castle Paravon needing coal to fuel the smithies for production of weapons and armour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_WA1}Marienburg
Settlement.text: {=!}Altdorf is at once perhaps the greatest city of the Empire and perhaps the entire known world, only rivaled in its size and importance by the likes of Marienburg, Nuln and Erengrad. Emperor Karl Franz rules both the Grand Principality of the Reikland and the Empire of Sigmar from this sprawling city, and what better a capital than the city founded by Sigmar himself two and a half millennia ago? Besides for its history, Altdorf is geographically the focal point of trade for three quarters of the Empire; for here all of the goods and travel from the states of Ostermark, Talabecland, Hochland, Stirland, Wissenland and Averland must go before they can move down the Reik to Marienburg and beyond. The city also hosts numerous knightly orders, the center of the Sigmarite church and the eight Imperial colleges of magic. Despite this prosperity and importance, Altdorf is a restless city: overpopulated and ripe for political violence, much of the fair city and its services have been pushed to their limits.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_WA1_1}Broekwater
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_WA1_1}Frederheim is a small Reiklander village just north of Altdorf on the Altdorf-Middenheim road. While the town is a possession of Karl-Franz and is a part of Altdorf’s demesne, the Emperor has seen fit to give oversight of it in all but name to the Cult of Shallya. This is a result of the cult's request for an area in which to establish a walled hospice and sanatorium.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_WA1_2}Kalkaat
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_WA1_2}On the eastern side of the confluence of the rivers Taal and Reik sits the village of Kaldach. The town is notable particularly for being the demarcation of the Reikland/Talabecland border. Besides this, it remains a small farming community.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_WA1_3}Leydenhoven
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_WA1_3}Directly west of Altdorf, between the river Reik and the Weissbruck canal is the village of Hochloff. The town is known for the type of grain it raises the Hochloffkorn which is very well regarded for making a high quality flour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_WA1_4}Klessen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_WA1_3}Directly west of Altdorf, between the river Reik and the Weissbruck canal is the village of Hochloff. The town is known for the type of grain it raises the Hochloffkorn which is very well regarded for making a high quality flour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_WA2}Aarnau
Settlement.text: {=!}At the Confluence of the River Reik and the River Schilder sits the town of Schilderheim. Ruled by Graf Robert von Uhland, Schilderheim is an important river market down river from altdorf, being one of the last places that trade on the River Reik can stop before reaching Marienburg.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_WA2_1}Hollum
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_WA2_1}Holthusen is a town in western Reikland on the river Schilder. By road it lies between Eilhart and Schilderheim. The town's primary trade good is the Holthusen Hogshead barrel which is used across the empire to age or ferment their products before shipment. The barrels are said to be so sturdy as to be able to protect their contents even from direct cannon fire. Every year Holthusen hosts the Weinfest, a great gathering for wine tasting that requires an invite to enter. Of course the lack of invite does not stop the horde of wastrels and rogues who wish to drink the free wine provided by the festival. Weinfest also marks the only time of year during which the Golden Cask is brought out, which is said to contain the best wine in the Empire if not the entire Old World. Due to the town's forested location, it is frequently attacked by beastmen. The palisades and guards are normally strong enough to see the monsters off, but the townspeople fear the day this defence falls short. As such, some of the townspeople have been leaving casks of cheap wine at the edge of the woods in an attempt to appease the beastmen with tribute. This dubious practice likely will not be allowed to continue much longer.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_WA2_2}Harskamp
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_WA2_2}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the Reiklands best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_WA2_3}Oostwold
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_WA2_2}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the Reiklands best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_WA1}Fort Solace
Settlement.text: {=!}In the Suden Vorbergland of Reikland sits the market town of Stimmigen. Stimmigen sits on the river Ober, where the Stimmigen and Grey Lady canals meet. The town is especially famous for Ernwald, a variety of apples known for its sweet, yet tart taste, that the people of Stimmigen put into pies, pastries, crumbles and cider, as well as the infamous local dish ‘rat-apple stew.’ Stimmigen has a large population of Halflings, who specialise in the Ernwald cultivation as well as its derivative goods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_WA1_1}Gorssel
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_WA1_1}Naffdrof is an isolated village that sits along the Grey Lady Canal between Stimmigen and Hugeldal. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_WA1_2}Wouduin Tollstation
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_WA1_1}Naffdrof is an isolated village that sits along the Grey Lady Canal between Stimmigen and Hugeldal. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_WA2}Fort Bergbres
Settlement.text: {=!}In the Suden Vorbergland of Reikland sits the market town of Stimmigen. Stimmigen sits on the river Ober, where the Stimmigen and Grey Lady canals meet. The town is especially famous for Ernwald, a variety of apples known for its sweet, yet tart taste, that the people of Stimmigen put into pies, pastries, crumbles and cider, as well as the infamous local dish ‘rat-apple stew.’ Stimmigen has a large population of Halflings, who specialise in the Ernwald cultivation as well as its derivative goods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_WA2_1}Halsdorph
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_WA1_1}Naffdrof is an isolated village that sits along the Grey Lady Canal between Stimmigen and Hugeldal. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_WA2_2}Erlach
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_WA1_1}Naffdrof is an isolated village that sits along the Grey Lady Canal between Stimmigen and Hugeldal. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_WA2_3}Merxheim
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_WA1_1}Naffdrof is an isolated village that sits along the Grey Lady Canal between Stimmigen and Hugeldal. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_CO1}Couronne
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_CO1}The city of Parravon, built by the elves long ago, was cut from a lone mountain, Les Monts Seuls, and runs directly along the Grismerie river. Surrounded by deep chasms, it is a key fortress city in holding off any enemies from the Grey Mountains and beyond, from reaching central Bretonnia. Due to the location, many Dwarf families have flocked to Parravon. It is also notable for being the only place in Bretonnia where peasants can live in Stone houses. This is due to a trick of legal language; the homes the peasants carve out of the rock of Les Monts Seuls are considered ‘Caves’ and thus are not prohibited.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_CO1_1}Rennesse
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_CO1_1}The village of Allobroges is a renowned settlement for its particular horse breeders, even among Paravon which sees use of mainly Pegusi. Allobroges has a fair population and sees many visits by Nobles and Travelers alike.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_CO1_2}Savuile
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_CO1_2}Not far from the Grey Mountains lies Gentiane, a small village with a main focus on Iron mining within the Grey Mountains. Heavily patrolled due to its strategic nature, Gentiane holds Paravon’s economy by the pillars.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_CO1_3}Sanz
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_CO1_3}Near the Grey Lady Pass, Goyarde holds a decent size of villagers, and militia alike. Being the first village into Bretonnia from Grey Lady pass, it is quite defensible and strategic in nature.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_CO2}Chantillon
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_CO2}Found north of the Parravon forest, just north of the Hills of the Dead, and east of Castle Parravon lies Grunere. Its location offers it a decent defensive position at the base of the Grey Mountains, and the Hills of the Dead aids in its defence of the south from attack.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_CO2_1}Euresbourg
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_CO2_1}Holthusen is a town in western Reikland on the river Schilder. By road it lies between Eilhart and Schilderheim. The town's primary trade good is the Holthusen Hogshead barrel which is used across the empire to age or ferment their products before shipment. The barrels are said to be so sturdy as to be able to protect their contents even from direct cannon fire. Every year Holthusen hosts the Weinfest, a great gathering for wine tasting that requires an invite to enter. Of course the lack of invite does not stop the horde of wastrels and rogues who wish to drink the free wine provided by the festival. Weinfest also marks the only time of year during which the Golden Cask is brought out, which is said to contain the best wine in the Empire if not the entire Old World. Due to the town's forested location, it is frequently attacked by beastmen. The palisades and guards are normally strong enough to see the monsters off, but the townspeople fear the day this defence falls short. As such, some of the townspeople have been leaving casks of cheap wine at the edge of the woods in an attempt to appease the beastmen with tribute. This dubious practice likely will not be allowed to continue much longer.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_CO2_2}Entrammes
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_CO2_2}The small mining village of Vettard resides due south of the City of Grunere, past the Hills of the Dead. They are destitute and have learned to fend for their own when things get perilous.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_CO3}Hendaye
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_CO2}Found north of the Parravon forest, just north of the Hills of the Dead, and east of Castle Parravon lies Grunere. Its location offers it a decent defensive position at the base of the Grey Mountains, and the Hills of the Dead aids in its defence of the south from attack.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_CO2_1}Alencon
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_CO2_1}Holthusen is a town in western Reikland on the river Schilder. By road it lies between Eilhart and Schilderheim. The town's primary trade good is the Holthusen Hogshead barrel which is used across the empire to age or ferment their products before shipment. The barrels are said to be so sturdy as to be able to protect their contents even from direct cannon fire. Every year Holthusen hosts the Weinfest, a great gathering for wine tasting that requires an invite to enter. Of course the lack of invite does not stop the horde of wastrels and rogues who wish to drink the free wine provided by the festival. Weinfest also marks the only time of year during which the Golden Cask is brought out, which is said to contain the best wine in the Empire if not the entire Old World. Due to the town's forested location, it is frequently attacked by beastmen. The palisades and guards are normally strong enough to see the monsters off, but the townspeople fear the day this defence falls short. As such, some of the townspeople have been leaving casks of cheap wine at the edge of the woods in an attempt to appease the beastmen with tribute. This dubious practice likely will not be allowed to continue much longer.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_CO2_2}Caen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_CO2_2}The small mining village of Vettard resides due south of the City of Grunere, past the Hills of the Dead. They are destitute and have learned to fend for their own when things get perilous.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_CO3_3}Beauchamps
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_CO2_2}The small mining village of Vettard resides due south of the City of Grunere, past the Hills of the Dead. They are destitute and have learned to fend for their own when things get perilous.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_CO1}Castle Brilloinne
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_CO1}Located on the border of Montfort, Castle Vingtiennes holds the northern province of Parravon from attack, and overlooks the river Grismerie and Massif Orcal.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_CO1_1}Caudebec
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_CO1_1} In the west of Parravon, near the borders of Montfort, Laval holds a tight knit relationship with its neighbour, Etoy. They often trade goods, such as raw materials for leather and hides. During the Lily Day, the two villages have many weddings and hold a small festival.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_CO2}Castle Orne
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_MO2}Castle Chambonnay holds the southern border of Parravon from Quenelles, and is the first line of defence from attacks from the south of Bretonnia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_MO2_1}Bruleaux
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_CO2_1}Just south west of Castle Paravon lies the village of Lesevre, which hosts large deposits of Wood. Lesevre is very rich in wealth due to Castle Paravon needing coal to fuel the smithies for production of weapons and armour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_CO2}Castle Tancred
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_MO2}Castle Chambonnay holds the southern border of Parravon from Quenelles, and is the first line of defence from attacks from the south of Bretonnia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_CO3_1}Hautville
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_CO3_1}Just south west of Castle Paravon lies the village of Lesevre, which hosts large deposits of Wood. Lesevre is very rich in wealth due to Castle Paravon needing coal to fuel the smithies for production of weapons and armour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_LA1}Castle L’Anguille
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_LA1}Located in the heart of Bastonne, Castle Bastonne and the surrounding villages show many indications of their founder, the first king Gilles le Breton, or Gilles the Unifier. Castle Bastonne itself is almost always a pilgrimage for any Grail Knights, or any who wish to see the testimony of Gilles le Breton’s accomplishments.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_LA1_1}Brest
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_LA1_1}Directly east of Bastonne, Saint-Etienne surveys the eastern border of Bastonne with Montfort. Within the vast verdant fields, the ponies of Bastonne freely breed and openly commune with many Bastonnians. Indeed, they are even smart enough to realize they offer them much protection from the many creatures and monsters of Massif Orcal.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_LA1_2}Annemasse
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_LA1_2}North of Massif Orcal, the small settlement of Vichy endures constant raids from Greenskins and strange rat-like beastmen. Indeed, in the past the village elders were forced to “collaborate” with these strange rat-like beastmen to avoid destruction. They are a hardy breed of peasants and have sustained many traumas.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_LA1_3}Maromme
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_LA1_3}In the verdant green fields of Aurillac, the peasants there thrive off the trade of many Cattle hides and meats. Indeed whatever is left after the many tithes, Aurillac is able to make very little profit, and mainly survives off of communal farming.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_LA1}Castle Grasgar
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_LA1}Castle Garamont holds the southern border of Bastonne from the western border of Bordeleaux, and provides a watchful lookout of the forest of Chȃlons and the feet of the mountains of Massif Orcal. The garrison has held off many Greenskin invaders.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_LA1_1}Cottévrard
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_LA1_2}Ambert in the past has been raided, pillaged, and razed many times over in the past by Greenskin raiders from Massif Orcal. Calard of Garamont has sent many families to re-inhabit Ambert again, in a vain hope that the village will continue its production of timber from the Chalons Forest.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_LA2}Castle Serrac
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_LA2}Lying just before the borders of Gisoreux, the fortress of Sangasse is a sentinel for any monsters or creatures that wish to venture out from the Arden forest. Indeed, many Beastmen raids have been thwarted by the garrison of knights stationed here.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_LA2_1}Serrac
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_LA2_1}Behind the defenses of Castle Sangasse, Cusset harbors a small salt deposit right off the bank of the Grismerie river. Most of its supply of salt is directed straight to Castle Bastonne’s kitchens and warehouses.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_LA3}Castle Sannez
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_LA3}On the Grismerie river, right across from the cursed city of Mousillon, Castle Riom stand firm directly in sight of the undead that many dread to plague Bretonnia. Many of the militia stationed in Castle Riom have heard dreadful noises coming from just across the river.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_LA3_1}Le Puy
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_LA3_1}The village of Laps is home to a hardened group of men and women who have had to fight the dangers of Mousillon for their homes for centuries. Many of Laps’ inhabitants voluntarily ask for employment under their protector Luca Loup so they can take the fight to the haggard entities that call Mousillon their home.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_LY1}Castle Lyonesse
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_LY1}Right on the border between the Land of Chivalry and the Forest of Loren, is Ducal Capital and Fortress-City of Quenelles. The city is so close to the Forest in fact, that the fey have demanded of the Quenellians to tear down the wall on the eastern side. Where the wall ends is met with a broad road and then immediately the fringes of the fey forest.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_LY1_1}Barfleur
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_LY1_1}Perrach is a small farming community on the road between Castle Quenelles and Merceaux Descloux. The peasants here nar to go towards the woods in any way, so in fear they are of the Fey who watch over them from the shade of the trees.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_LY1_2}Sablé
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_LY1_2}In the flatlands of Quenelles, surrounded by a sea of grassgrasses and farmlands, is the village of Nailloux. The peasants here raise cattle on the fine grasses for most of the year. When it comes time to drive the cattle to market in Quenelles, the village becomes nearly uninhabited, as most of the population leaves along with their cattle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_LY2}Martel
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_LY2}Nestled in the hills bordering Massif Orcal, sits the fortress town of Viefin. Viefin was established originally as a garrison to protect Quenelles from Greenskins that come down out of the mountains, as well as a position to launch attempts at founding new villages in the region.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_LY2_1}Portsall
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_LY2_1}Chinon was founded as one of a score of settlements in the Massif Orcal mountains and is the only one still remaining. The peasants here recently found a vein of high quality iron, which has afforded the hamlet much extra protection and vigilance from its protectors.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_LY2_2}Voiron
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_LY2_2}Gien is an old timber enterprise, founded long ago to provide building material for the Dukedom. With only the fools willing to even step foot near the forest of the fey, Quenelles sought out a new source of wood. Despite the dangers present in the Forest of Chalons, it is far safer to deal with the cloven ones than anger the elves.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_LY3}Soreil
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_LY2}Nestled in the hills bordering Massif Orcal, sits the fortress town of Viefin. Viefin was established originally as a garrison to protect Quenelles from Greenskins that come down out of the mountains, as well as a position to launch attempts at founding new villages in the region.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_LY3_1}Carequefou
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_LY3_1}Chinon was founded as one of a score of settlements in the Massif Orcal mountains and is the only one still remaining. The peasants here recently found a vein of high quality iron, which has afforded the hamlet much extra protection and vigilance from its protectors.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_LY1}Barley Motte
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_LY1}Castle Beaumarchais sits strategically between three important areas; Massif Orcal, the border with Parravon and the Loren forest. While Quenellian relations with the fey are… amicable, The Castle was built far enough from the border of the woods to prevent the wood elves interference with its walls such as at Castle Quenelles.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_LYI_3}Le Havre
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_LY1_1}Founded by Shallyan cultists, Merceaux Descloux has grown as those seeking cures for their ailments have begun to settle around the monastery in thanks. These supplicants have built small homes and tilled the land, providing for everything the cultists here need.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_LY2}Sigmarsheim
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_LY2}Castle Carrad sits on the shore of the River Brienne near the border of Carcassonne and the Forest of Loren. Its lord, Leofric Carrard, has inherited the fief in absentia. His father had given him permission to embark on his Grail Quest but as soon as Leofric left, his father grew gravely ill and passed into the arms of the Lady. Duke Tancred II has taken stewardship here until Leofric returns.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_LY1_3}Contremoulins
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_LY2_1}Nice is an old village, so old in fact that some Nobles suspect that the fey originally inhabited it. Despite this suspicion, the Fey have never disturbed the village, at least not in a manner particular compared to the normal demands and restrictions.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_LY3}Ora Lamae
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_LY3}Castle Laguiller is both a castle and a major river port along the River Brienne. Nearby is the Grave of Cuileux, a Quenellian holy site where the founder of the Dukedom is entered.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_LY3_1}Dieppe
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_LY3_1}On the river Brienne, sits the large farming village of Brusse. It was established by its lord as a plantation to grow flax for the industries in Quenelles.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_GX1}Castle Gisoreux
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_GX1} The fortress city and the ducal capital of Carcassonne, Castle Carcassonne sits on an island surrounded by the river Songez. Due to the defensive location Castle Carcassonne is designed to be more of a fortress rather than a city, however there is a small town attached to the castle that acts as a marketplace and hub for many travelers and Knights who seek services.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_GX1_1}Pierrelatte
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_GX1_1}Located near the Border of Carcassonne and Brionne on the river Brienne, maintains a trusting relationship with the outlying villages of Lunel and Vauvert, having been trade partners for ages past.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_GX1_2}Ernée
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_GX1_2}Located at the base of the Irana Mountains, the village of Albi has been host to countless raids from Greenskin tribes. As such, the shepherds have become battle hardened and will defend their village from any oncoming monstrosities.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_GX2}Hautmont
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_GX2}Located in the Vaults , the City of Turin is the capital of the Barony of Savoie. The region is influenced heavily by nearby Tilea, despite this the city and people are steadfastly loyal to Bretonnia. Holding the famed relic, the “Shroud of Gilles le Breton” the City of Turin is a Pilgrimage site to all who follow the Lady of the Lake, and all who seek visions of the Lady.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_GX2_1}Florid
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_GX2_1}Having been sacked by Greenskin invaders many times in the past, the population of Montebaun is very low. Being one of the few timber villages in carcassonne, the remaining peasants here are often worked to the bone.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_GX2_2}Pâles
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_GX2_2}Sitting south of the Quenelles border and the river Brienne, the village of Chanaz is a small farming community that provides its grain to the City of Turin.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_GX1}Castle Oisillon
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_GX1}Located on the western border of Carcassonne and at the base of the Irana Mountains, Toulouse is a vital defensive position that holds the River Niveau crossing, that separates the border of Carcassonne and Estalia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_GX1_2}Oisill
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_GX1_1}Condom is a timber village located in the most north western part of Carcassonne, that borders Estalia and the Duchy of Brionne.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_GX2}Castle Desfleuve
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_GX2}A small fortress settlement on the Southern Reach of Bretonnia near the Tilean border. Once besieged by the armies of Tilea, the siege turned to a massacre when Ser Der Raker broke the assailants single handedly.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_GX2_1}Fouesnant
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_GX2_1}In the eastern plains of Carcassonne, Yenne sits just opposite of the village Perpignan on the river Pou. Just outside of Yenne lies the Burial Mound of Grundsnik, an orc warboss who was defeated many centuries ago. Orcs occasionally come here, seeking to reclaim Grundsnik’s treasure.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_GX2_1}Betton
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_GX2_2}A small mining village on the eastern base of the Irana Mountains and the Western Vaults, the Village of Cugnaux are hardened miners, working iron for the city of Turin and beyond.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_GX3}Castle Ardé
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_GX3}Located near the borders of the Loren Forrest, Castle Gaudaron is an ever watchful eye that stands at the base of the Vaults mountain range. Castle Gaudaron is a key position for maintaining Bretonnian rule over the northern end of the Novalone Pass, as well as for guarding the Loren highway.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_GX3_1}Bonchamp
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_GX3_1}Salignac La Rouge is the last Bretonnian settlement along the Loren Highway. Travelers heading towards Kreutzhafen will typically pick up anything they need for the long journey there from the peasants here. The people here feel uncomfortably close to the Fey of Cavaroc, but relations with Athel Loren remain as amicable as possible.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_AS1}Castle Artois
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_AS1} The fortress city and the ducal capital of Carcassonne, Castle Carcassonne sits on an island surrounded by the river Songez. Due to the defensive location Castle Carcassonne is designed to be more of a fortress rather than a city, however there is a small town attached to the castle that acts as a marketplace and hub for many travelers and Knights who seek services.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AS1_1}Uesin
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AS1_1}Located near the Border of Carcassonne and Brionne on the river Brienne, maintains a trusting relationship with the outlying villages of Lunel and Vauvert, having been trade partners for ages past.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AS1_2}Odemar
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AS1_2}Located at the base of the Irana Mountains, the village of Albi has been host to countless raids from Greenskin tribes. As such, the shepherds have become battle hardened and will defend their village from any oncoming monstrosities.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_AS2}Larret
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_AS2}Located in the Vaults , the City of Turin is the capital of the Barony of Savoie. The region is influenced heavily by nearby Tilea, despite this the city and people are steadfastly loyal to Bretonnia. Holding the famed relic, the “Shroud of Gilles le Breton” the City of Turin is a Pilgrimage site to all who follow the Lady of the Lake, and all who seek visions of the Lady.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AS2_1}Ambricourt
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AS2_1}Having been sacked by Greenskin invaders many times in the past, the population of Montebaun is very low. Being one of the few timber villages in carcassonne, the remaining peasants here are often worked to the bone.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AS2_2}Lanester
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AS2_2}Sitting south of the Quenelles border and the river Brienne, the village of Chanaz is a small farming community that provides its grain to the City of Turin.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_AS1}Castle Arras
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_AS1}Located on the western border of Carcassonne and at the base of the Irana Mountains, Toulouse is a vital defensive position that holds the River Niveau crossing, that separates the border of Carcassonne and Estalia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AS1_2}Guingamp
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AS1_1}Condom is a timber village located in the most north western part of Carcassonne, that borders Estalia and the Duchy of Brionne.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_AS2}Castle Lens
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_AS2}A small fortress settlement on the Southern Reach of Bretonnia near the Tilean border. Once besieged by the armies of Tilea, the siege turned to a massacre when Ser Der Raker broke the assailants single handedly.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AS2_1}Oissel
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AS2_1}In the eastern plains of Carcassonne, Yenne sits just opposite of the village Perpignan on the river Pou. Just outside of Yenne lies the Burial Mound of Grundsnik, an orc warboss who was defeated many centuries ago. Orcs occasionally come here, seeking to reclaim Grundsnik’s treasure.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_AS3}Castle Béthune
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_AS3}Located near the borders of the Loren Forrest, Castle Gaudaron is an ever watchful eye that stands at the base of the Vaults mountain range. Castle Gaudaron is a key position for maintaining Bretonnian rule over the northern end of the Novalone Pass, as well as for guarding the Loren highway.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AS3_1}Tournon
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AS3_1}Salignac La Rouge is the last Bretonnian settlement along the Loren Highway. Travelers heading towards Kreutzhafen will typically pick up anything they need for the long journey there from the peasants here. The people here feel uncomfortably close to the Fey of Cavaroc, but relations with Athel Loren remain as amicable as possible.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_MO1}Montfort
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_MO1} The Fortress city of Montfort, sits at the opposite end of Axe Bite Pass. Encompassed in five tiers of towering stone walls, the Illustrious trade centre is renowned for its fine quality crafts, including Steel weapons and armours, owed to the close association of the Dwarfs of the Grey Mountains.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MO1_1}Jouinard
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MO1_1} A small village located near the Bretonnian Entrance to Axe Bite Pass. Jouinard acts as a small trade settlement before encroaching on Montfort.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MO1_2}Hachepied
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MO1_2}The hamlet of Hachpied, across the river from Montfort, is a small cattle farm that provides Castle Montfort with a steady supply of Meats and Hides.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MO1_3}Noyers
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MO1_3}Noyers lies at the entrance of axe bite pass and is the first Bretonnia contact coming through the pass. Unfortunately, due to the Empire and Bretonnia’s constant engagements over axe bite pass, the village of Noyers is littered with graves and corpses.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_MO2}Poussenc
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_MO2}Sitting north west of Montfort, the City of Poussenc rests on the River Grismerie. The markets of Poussenc are often flooded with Golden jewellery and crafts, thanks to it neighbouring the gold rich Grey Mountains.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MO2_1}Les Chalesmes
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MO2_1}Huddled on the north side of the Grismerie river, the village of Les Chalesmes is a small farming village that provides most of its harvest to the city of Poussenc.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MO2_2}Sirod
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MO2_2}Sirod is a small village that is not very populous, nor flourishing, and that holds a deep clay deposit just off the river bank of the Grismerie river.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MO2_3}Ardon
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MO2_3}In the small woodlands east of Poussenc, the hamlet of Ardon provides Poussenc with timber for many of the cities' construction and outfitting their militias with bows and arrows.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_MO1}Hemmerle
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_MO1}Castle Hemmerle sits on the border of Parravon and Montfort, along the river Grismerie. It is a key defensive choke point into Montfort when approaching from the south.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_MO1_1}Bière
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_MO1_1}West of Montfort, the small village of Bière, provides Castle Montfort's supply of mounts for the stables. Although small, Horse breeders are never in short supply in the Horse Duchies of Bretonnia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_MO1_2}Etoy
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_MO1_2}The hogs of Etoy provide most of its meat and its leather hides to Castle Montfort. The rest is usually reserved for the village itself or as a trade good for any adventurers or other villages needing such goods. Due to the location, Etoy has a good relationship with the small village of Laval in Parravon, and they often trade goods and hold small festivals together.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_MO2}Valenfort
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_MO2}Nestled into the Grey Mountains, Castle Valenfort stands tall above the mountains providing a long sightline along the river coast.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_MO2_1}Les Auxons
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_MO2_1}Les Auxons holds a small knit community of villagers who farm flax for the cities of Montfort. Despite being neither prosperous nor populous, the work they do does not go unnoticed and is often protected from Greenskin raids.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_MO2_2}Boult
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_MO2_2} Along a small stream that runs from Axe Bite Pas, and into the Grismerie river, lies the small hamlet of Boult. The residents there work in the small salt mines up into the sides of Axe Bite Pass and into the Grey Mountains.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_MO3}Guette Orcal
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_MO3}Neighbouring the Mountains of Massif Orcal, Guette Orcal sits at its base, ready to pursue any and all greenskin raids coming from the Mountains.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_MO3_1}Gilley
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_MO3_1}Just east of Guette Orcal lies the hamlet of Giley, a small fishing village sitting on the Grismerie river. The village is not very prosperous due to increasing raids from Greenskins.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_MO3_2}Morteau
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_MO3_2}Montfort, fertile and rock free soil is in short supply, making Morteau, or rather its soil, critical to abating famine. As a result, Morteauan peasants are thought of as fat and lazy by their fellows.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_PA1}Parravon
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_PA1}The city of Parravon, built by the elves long ago, was cut from a lone mountain, Les Monts Seuls, and runs directly along the Grismerie river. Surrounded by deep chasms, it is a key fortress city in holding off any enemies from the Grey Mountains and beyond, from reaching central Bretonnia. Due to the location, many Dwarf families have flocked to Parravon. It is also notable for being the only place in Bretonnia where peasants can live in Stone houses. This is due to a trick of legal language; the homes the peasants carve out of the rock of Les Monts Seuls are considered ‘Caves’ and thus are not prohibited.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_PA1_1}Allobroges
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_PA1_1}The village of Allobroges is a renowned settlement for its particular horse breeders, even among Paravon which sees use of mainly Pegusi. Allobroges has a fair population and sees many visits by Nobles and Travelers alike.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_PA1_2}Gentiane
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_PA1_2}Not far from the Grey Mountains lies Gentiane, a small village with a main focus on Iron mining within the Grey Mountains. Heavily patrolled due to its strategic nature, Gentiane holds Paravon’s economy by the pillars.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_PA1_3}Goyarde
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_PA1_3}Near the Grey Lady Pass, Goyarde holds a decent size of villagers, and militia alike. Being the first village into Bretonnia from Grey Lady pass, it is quite defensible and strategic in nature.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_PA2}Grunere
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_PA2}Found north of the Parravon forest, just north of the Hills of the Dead, and east of Castle Parravon lies Grunere. Its location offers it a decent defensive position at the base of the Grey Mountains, and the Hills of the Dead aids in its defence of the south from attack.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_PA2_1}Clemenceau
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_PA2_1}Clemenceau is a village located halfway between Grunere Castle and the Forest of Athel Loren.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_PA2_2}Vettard
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_PA2_2}The small mining village of Vettard resides due south of the City of Grunere, past the Hills of the Dead. They are destitute and have learned to fend for their own when things get perilous.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_PA2_3}la Maisontaal
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_PA2_3}The small cloister of La Maisontaal abbey is home to a host of Taalite monks. Home to the Holy Wardens of La Maisontaal, these Battle Monks will learn to fight in the ways of war and join Grail Knights on their own quests to collect relics.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_PA1}Vingtiennes
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_PA1}Located on the border of Montfort, Castle Vingtiennes holds the northern province of Parravon from attack, and overlooks the river Grismerie and Massif Orcal.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_PA1_1}Laval
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_PA1_1} In the west of Parravon, near the borders of Montfort, Laval holds a tight knit relationship with its neighbour, Etoy. They often trade goods, such as raw materials for leather and hides. During the Lily Day, the two villages have many weddings and hold a small festival.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_PA1_2}Tabanet
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_PA1_2}Tabanet is a small militarised village that houses most of the Militia Guards of Castle Vingtiennes. Even though the village focuses on wheat farming, the Villagers, and Guards, will protect their homes with their lives.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_MO2}Castle Chambonnay
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_MO2}Castle Chambonnay holds the southern border of Parravon from Quenelles, and is the first line of defence from attacks from the south of Bretonnia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_MO2_1}Lesevre
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_PA2_1}Just south west of Castle Paravon lies the village of Lesevre, which hosts large deposits of Wood. Lesevre is very rich in wealth due to Castle Paravon needing coal to fuel the smithies for production of weapons and armour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_PA2_2}Emilion
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_PA1_2}Directly in Castle Parravon’s sights sits the hamlet of Emilion directly alongside the Grismerie river. Emilion is a very small knit community that stays afloat from trading fish and food to other villages and Castle Parravon.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_BA1}Castle Bastonne
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_BA1}Located in the heart of Bastonne, Castle Bastonne and the surrounding villages show many indications of their founder, the first king Gilles le Breton, or Gilles the Unifier. Castle Bastonne itself is almost always a pilgrimage for any Grail Knights, or any who wish to see the testimony of Gilles le Breton’s accomplishments.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BA1_1}Saint-Etienne
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BA1_1}Directly east of Bastonne, Saint-Etienne surveys the eastern border of Bastonne with Montfort. Within the vast verdant fields, the ponies of Bastonne freely breed and openly commune with many Bastonnians. Indeed, they are even smart enough to realize they offer them much protection from the many creatures and monsters of Massif Orcal.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BA1_2}Vichy
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BA1_2}North of Massif Orcal, the small settlement of Vichy endures constant raids from Greenskins and strange rat-like beastmen. Indeed, in the past the village elders were forced to “collaborate” with these strange rat-like beastmen to avoid destruction. They are a hardy breed of peasants and have sustained many traumas.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BA1_3}Aurillac
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BA1_3}In the verdant green fields of Aurillac, the peasants there thrive off the trade of many Cattle hides and meats. Indeed whatever is left after the many tithes, Aurillac is able to make very little profit, and mainly survives off of communal farming.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_BA2}Soude
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_BA2}In the north of Bastonne on the Grismerie river, near the Montfort border, the small city of Soude dwells. Being in the Heartlands of Bretonnia, the marketplaces of Soude are often filled to the brim with many goods that come from across Bretonnia. Including even foreign goods from the Empire, and the Wood Elves of the Loren Forest. Due to the nearness of Montfort, relations are straining, and long ago many border wars between the two dukedoms occurred.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BA2_1}Clermont-Ferrand
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BA2_1}Clermont-Ferrand is a little fishing village along the Grismerie river that sits across from the Montfort border. The village is fairly small sized due to fish not being a huge export out of the village.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BA2_2}Issoire
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BA2_2}Located in northern Bastonne, Issoire is a predominantly farming community with some small abodes available for passerby adventurers or pilgrims on their way to Castle Bastonne.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BA2_3}Thiers
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BA2_3}Located at the northernmost point of Bastonne, Thiers lies on the border of Giseroux. Thiers is a small trade hub that is visited by many caravans from the dukedom of Giseroux, but has had a harsh bit of bad luck recently due to dreadful Beastmen raids coming from the Arden forest.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BA1}Castle Garamont
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_BA1}Castle Garamont holds the southern border of Bastonne from the western border of Bordeleaux, and provides a watchful lookout of the forest of Chȃlons and the feet of the mountains of Massif Orcal. The garrison has held off many Greenskin invaders.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BA1_1}Ambert
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BA1_2}Ambert in the past has been raided, pillaged, and razed many times over in the past by Greenskin raiders from Massif Orcal. Calard of Garamont has sent many families to re-inhabit Ambert again, in a vain hope that the village will continue its production of timber from the Chalons Forest.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BA1_2}Montluçon
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BA1_2}Contrary to its unlucky neighbor Ambert, Montluçon is a thriving village that provides most of its breeds of horse to Castle Garamont’s stables and the other directly to Castle Bastonne. It is well protected by Calard and some of its inhabitants have ventured to Ambert to re-colonise it.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BA2}Castle Sangasse
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_BA2}Lying just before the borders of Gisoreux, the fortress of Sangasse is a sentinel for any monsters or creatures that wish to venture out from the Arden forest. Indeed, many Beastmen raids have been thwarted by the garrison of knights stationed here.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BA2_1}Cusset
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BA2_1}Behind the defenses of Castle Sangasse, Cusset harbors a small salt deposit right off the bank of the Grismerie river. Most of its supply of salt is directed straight to Castle Bastonne’s kitchens and warehouses.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BA2_2}Châtel-Guyon
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BA2_2}Built inside the old remains of a small castle, Châtel-Guyon is a small farming community that harvests flax from its fields. Due to the location, the fields are vibrant and yield extraordinary amounts of silk. Many inhabitants believe great battles were once fought in the very fields of Châtel-Guyon to bring about its great harvests.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BA3}Castle Riom
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BA3}On the Grismerie river, right across from the cursed city of Mousillon, Castle Riom stand firm directly in sight of the undead that many dread to plague Bretonnia. Many of the militia stationed in Castle Riom have heard dreadful noises coming from just across the river.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BA3_1}Laps
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BA3_1}The village of Laps is home to a hardened group of men and women who have had to fight the dangers of Mousillon for their homes for centuries. Many of Laps’ inhabitants voluntarily ask for employment under their protector Luca Loup so they can take the fight to the haggard entities that call Mousillon their home.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BA3_2}Ardes
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BA3_2} Directly east of the dread city of Mousillon lies Ardes. The hamlet has been targeted for many raids by bandits, highwaymen, and even cultists. Its closeness to Mousillon has always made it easy pickings for the horrors that dwell in the cloudy mists of Mousillon.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_BL1}Castle Bordeleaux
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_BL1}Built upon ancient stonework, the fortress-city of Bordeleaux is perhaps the most important harbour in Bretonnia, rivalled only by Lyon. Castle Bordeleaux sits on a cliff which rises above the harbour, looking over the entire sprawling city and nearby sea traffic. It is said that the engines on its walls, and their skilled engineers, are capable of sinking a moored rowboat without damaging the boats to either side. The city is home to two major holy sites in the realm, the First Chapel of Castle Bordeleaux, the most sacred Grail Chapel in the kingdom; and the Temple of Manaan, of which some say rivals even the temple in Marienburg.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BL2_1}Saint-Junien
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BL1_1}Right on the coast of the Great Ocean is the village of Saint Junien. Saint Junien was named after a grail knight who long ago defended the peasants in the area from mysterious sea devils. The peasants here continue to rely on Manaan for their livelihood, though many visitors note that they always seem to have one eye out towards the watery horizon.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BL1_2}Aigre
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BL1_2}Sitting on the road between Tureene and Bordeleaux is Aigre. Aigre is an idyllic place, the peasants here seem content most years and grain normally comes in abundance.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BL1_2}Niort
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BL1_3}The area around Niort is famous for its vineyards. The fruit produced here makes a nice red wine, favoured by many nobles all over Bretonnia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_BL2}Turenne
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_BL2}The peasant town of Turenne, though lowly, is nothing to scoff at. The people here live under the protection of the duke and while most make their living in the fields around the town, there are those peasants that have taken up a craft or trade near the town square. Turenne is a town dependent on the excesses of Bordeleaux, merchants needing a simple place to stop can often find cheaper rooms and supplies here.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BL2_1}Parthenay
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BL2_1}Surrounded by rocky crags, the isolated village of Parthenay sits on a hill overlooking the lands of Bordelen and, across the River Grismerie, Mousillon. The people here haul up salt from the beaches below, pack it, and send it to Turenne to their south.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BL2_2}Anglet
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BL2_2}The people of Anglet pride themselves on breeding some of the best riding stock this side of Massif Orcal. Every year, the peasants round up the various herds, and drive them to market in Bordeleaux.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BL2_3}Royan
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BL2_3}Royan lays in a low and wide gulley, sheltered from the winds that constantly blow across the coastal plains of Bordeleaux. The depression also provides some sanctuary from norscan raiders, who often are unable to see it from the ocean.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BL1}Turris Vigilans
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BL1}De Turris Vigilans, the vigilant tower, is a centre of Verenan worship in Bretonnia. In addition to a large temple, the cult maintains a great lighthouse which is widely considered to be the most reliable in the world. The Priests of Verena here will often offer advice to those that seek their counsel, and are reputable for its benefits. The Cult and the Dukedom of Bordeleaux have the shared interest in watching the cursed land to their north, as a result; the Duke has established a garrison here and the fortifications are always maintained.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BL1_1}Daglan
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BL1_1}Daglan is a small farming village that provides the nearby temple of Verena with most of its foodstuffs. The fruit grown here is known for its hardiness, and can make a decent vintage.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BL1_2}Talence
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BL1_2}The fish that come down into the brackish waters of the River Grismerie are known for their size and their taste. Really, many local nobles suppose that is the only reason the peasants continue to dwell in Talence, being far too close to the marshes of cursed Mousillon for their liking.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BL2}Castle Saint Jean-de-Luz
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_BL2}A small castle, established to watch over the farms and woodlands of east Bordelen. It is named after a long dead noble who stopped an orc warboss from Massif Orcal on the grounds where the castle now sits.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BL2_1}Belves
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BL2_1}In the middle of the rolling plains is the village of Belves. Belves has some of the most.. provincial peasants in Bordeleaux. Their lord rarely comes here, with the yeoman tax collector often being the only visitor to Belves for years at a time.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BL2_2}Sare
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BL2_2}Sare Saddlebreds are dependable mounts for any knights, yeomen or traveller. The people here pride themselves on producing steads of the highest quality, the result of course is that they only produce a few every season.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BL3}Castle Châtellerault
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_BL3}On the edge of the Forest of Châlons sits Castle Châtellerault. Châlons is a dangerous and twisted place; dark trees stand over deep ravines, boulders and chasms. One shouldn't be mistaken, it has its beauties; sweet and cool streams, waterfalls and calm pools dot the undergrowth. It is even said that the true sacred lake of the lady lies somewhere within this forest. With this land, comes the typical predations, greenskins, beastmen and far worse make their homes, and so Châtellerault stands its watch against incursion.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BL3_1}Monpazier
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BL3_1}Delving into the forest of Châlons for timber, the woodsmen of Monpazier are some of the bravest peasants in all Bordelen. Their daily task brings them almost constantly into contact with beastmen and other foul monstrosities.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BL3_2}Limeuil
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BL3_2}The peasants of Limeuil venture into the outlying crags of Massif Orcal, looking for sites for clay pits. While they bring back a good amount of clay, they also tell tales of the things they encounter at the foot of the mountains. The local lord has on more than one occasion deemed fit to send men-at-arms into the foothills. What they fought there remains unknown to most.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_BE1}Castle Brionne
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_BE1}The jewel of Bretonnia, as Brionnians would have you believe, is a remarkable city built out of the local white stone and the high quality sand from its bay, which is one of the things Brionne is famous for. The city is well defended thanks to its location, lone towers watch over the land that can withstand against entire armies with but a small garrison. The Hall of Minstrels is the most important building in Brionne, as many would be bards and minstrels hone their skills here. The hall is surrounded by a large garden, which in times of war can be used as a killing room to dispose of invaders. It is a beautiful circular structure made from polished white stone, the inside is home to an auditorium with flawless acoustics, which minstrels use at any time of the day or night.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BE1_1}Lourdes
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BE1_1}On the coast of the Great Ocean, the village of Lourdes ekes out a meagre existence as a fishing village. Delivering “fresh” fish directly to Castle Brionne.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BE1_2}Tournefeuille
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BE1_2}The village of Tournefeuille, the last settlement on the River Brienne before Castle Brionne. The villagers here take care of great herds of cattle, providing much of the meat needed by the dukedom.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BE1_3}Beaucaire
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BE1_3}A moderately rich farming village near Brionne, Beaucaire acts as a crossroads between the surrounding villages and Brionne so it sees a decent bit of traffic, thanks to the local toll booth the village is slightly more prosperous than the others, but still just as run down.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_BE1}Chateau Frontière
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_BE1}A site of many sieges from Norsca in ages past, ever since Alaron the Intrepid aided in the defence against Bjorn Irongrim and his army of mercenaries, the frequency of raids on Brionne have died down significantly. Due to its strategic location, Chateau Frontière holds many relics from the crusades.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BE2_1}Lunel
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BE2_1}Lunel sees many travellers pass by as they live close to the bridge that connects them with Carcassonne, be they adventuring knights or merchants. The village therefore is looked after more than others, so passing nobles can at least somewhat bear to look at it.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BE2_1}Gaillac
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BE2_2}Gaillac doesn’t get many visitors, being so out of the way, yet caravans often leave to deliver crops to Chateau Frontière. Gaillac is one of the biggest food producers of Brionne.Gaillac, a remote location that often goes unnoticed, being so far away from the main roads. The village is a bustling hub for caravans that transport crops to Chateau Frontière. Gaillac holds a critical role in Brionne’s food production.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_BE2_1}Vauvert
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_BE2_2}Rows of grapevines run along the village of Vauvert. With fresh water nearby the grapes are very juicy and rich in taste; while it can’t compete with the wine of Bordeleaux it still quenches the thirst of the local nobility.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BL3}Castle Gransette
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_BL3}Castle Gransette, the site of a great tragedy in ages past, a tragedy worthy of any song. The lady Isolde took the knight Sir Gaseric as her lover, but unfortunately her husband was not keen on becoming a superfluous husband. He locked Lady Isolde in her tower and challenged Sir Gaseric to a duel. He agreed, on the condition that it was held in the court so Lady Isolde could watch. The duel never happened, as the two knights were about to clash their steel a horde of zombies befell them. It is said that the zombies were defeated by a group of adventurers, but they never returned, and neither did any group that was sent to investigate. The local duke, the only living relative of Lord Gransette, has taken up residence after a substantial cleansing of the castle, despite this, the castle staff reports that the castle is still haunted, hearing footsteps and moans around corners. It was even reported by the groundskeeper, that on one fateful night, he saw the apparitions of Sir Gaseric and Lord Gransette duelling each other, still fighting for their long lost love.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BE1_1}Mende
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BE1_1}A somewhat dour village along the northern border, when Castle Gransette was beset by zombies many of those who fled, fled to Mende, dragging several zombies in tow. The attack was repelled, but it left its mark on the village; houses are more rundown and desolate than usual, and the faint stench of death still lingers in the air.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BE1_2}Collioure
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BE1_2}The local nobility is more keen to make visits to Collioure, as they supply most of Brionne with olives, used for their cuisine. This is why the village is more staunchly protected in times of need.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BE3}Castle Hossegor
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_BE3}Castle Hossegor is more of a giant hospital than a mere fortress. Inside, nobles receive the finest treatments from priestesses of Shallya; while outside peasants beseech the many wisemen and healers that flock to the area. Some complain about receiving their treatment in the open air, but many of the practitioners believe this separation protects their noble clients and disperses the more vile miasmas brought here by the peasants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BE2_1}Foix
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BE2_1}The bleating of the herds of local sheep drown out most of the noises during the day, Foix delivers copious amounts of cotton to Castle Hossegor to be used for bandages and cleaning materials.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BE2_2}Colomier
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BE2_2}Nestled in the rolling hills and verdant fields, lies Colomier, where the air is always fragrant with the aroma of herbs. The village is a picturesque haven with neat rows of herbs that flourish under the warm rays of the sun. The villagers take great pride in their craft, carefully tending to their plants with love and care.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BE3}Castle Portet
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BE3}Also known as the castle of glass, renowned for its breathtaking stained glass windows, it stands as a testament to Brionnian architectural grandeur and artistic mastery, the castle emanates an enchanting aura, which pulls in many visitors from all over Bretonnia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BE3_1}Billère
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BE3_1}The village of Billère is surrounded by fields and pastures, with castle Portet looming in the distance, a constant reminder of the feudal system that governs the life of the locals. The villagers are hardworking and resilient, eking out a living from the land and the trades they have honed over generations.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_BE3_2}Saverdun
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_BE3_2}The village of Saverdun is a dusty and bustling place, with narrow streets and buildings. Despite the arduous and often dangerous nature of their work, these villagers are a tight-knit community, bound together by a shared sense of purpose and a deep respect for the land. They know the secrets of clay, how to shape it, and finding the best veins to mine.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_AQ1}Castle Aquitaine
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_AQ1}Located in the southwestern region of the dukedom lies its distinguished capital city of Aquitaine. The cityscape is dominated by the majestic ducal castle, which stands as a testament to the grandeur of the region. The castle is renowned for its remarkable Lace Tower, a towering spire crafted with an intricate design of numerous windows, giving it the appearance of delicate stone lace.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AQ1_1}Bayonne
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AQ1_1}Nestled in the shadow of Castle Aquitaine, the village of Bayonne exudes charm and tranquillity. Surrounded by lush meadows, it is one of the more peaceful villages of the already tranquil dukedom.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AQ1_2}Pau
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AQ1_2}Situated to the east of Castle Aquitaine is the hamlet of Pau. Surrounded by vibrant fauna, Pau is a rather small hamlet with its quaint cottages and serene brook that winds through its centre.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AQ1_3}Hasparren
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AQ1_3}Known for its skilled weavers, Hasparren thrives on its vibrant market, where the fruits of their labour are traded with fervour. The peasants, hardy and resourceful, draw strength from their close-knit community and the protective presence of the nearby castle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_AQ2}Château D'Epee
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_AQ2}Standing as the pinnacle of Aquitainian fortification, Chateau D'Epee is an awe-inspiring castle situated near the border of Brionne. The castle's origins can be traced back to Lord D'Epee's great-grandfather, a legendary adventuring knight known for his involvement in numerous feuds and exploits not unusual for an Aquitainian. Harnessing his accumulated wealth, he constructed this very fortress that would soon stand to defy all assailants for decades to come.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AQ2_1}Derrevin Libre
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AQ2_1}Situated on the far northern fringes of Aquitaine's domain, Derrevin is marked by its proximity to the Forest of Châlons to its north. The village's once-thriving population has dwindled, its homes and streets displaying scars of past feuds.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AQ2_2}Pessac
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AQ2_2}Pessac remains its mark on the map for a reason; the popularity of its white wine vintage. Pessac wine is one of the best Aquitaine wines, valued for its light, crisp flavors and smooth undertows.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AQ2_3}Agen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AQ2_3}Agen stands as a bastion of agricultural resilience, proudly standing as one of the most fertile villages in the already fertile region.
