Its fertile farms yield an abundance of grains, providing sustenance for the entirety of the dukedom. The hard working peasants toil diligently to continue feeding the hungry people of Aquitaine.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_AQ1}Castle Libourne
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_AQ1}Nestled within the farmlands of Aquitaine, Castle Libourne rises as a bastion of elegance and refinement. Situated amidst rolling hills and verdant meadows, this picturesque castle exudes an air of tranquillity and grace that exemplifies the relative peace the dukedom is known for.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AQ1_1}Nérac
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AQ1_1}Known for its vast vineyards, Nérac once flourished as a centre of winemaking, but now the toil of its remaining inhabitants is relentless. Under the watchful eye of the ruling lord of Castle Libourne, the villagers of Nérac endure, their spirits tested by the harsh realities of their existence.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AQ1_2}Wainfleet
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AQ1_2}Perched on the northern outskirts of Castle Libourne, the village of Wainfleet presents a clear break in societal norms compared to the rest of Aquitaine. Wainfleet is where the pesant Grail Knight Ser Geg makes his court, and where numerous peasants flock to to become his... 'Squights.'

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_AQ2}Castle Monflanquin
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_AQ2}Rising majestically amidst the rugged landscapes of Aquitaine is Castle Monflanquin. Perched atop a hill, this stronghold epitomises strength and strategic advantage. Its stonework, weathered by the passage of time, exudes an aura of ancient resilience.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AQ2_2}Biarritz
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AQ2_1}Biarritz is a town south of Aquitaine Castle, near the border with Brionne.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AQ2_2}Ayherre
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AQ2_2}Compared to its sister village of Biarritz, the village of Ayherre serves as an idyllic retreat from the tumult of war, a sanctuary where weary adventurers find respite amidst the constant feuds of the dukedom. With fields of golden wheat stretching as far as the eye can see, Ayherre's economy thrives on agriculture, its diligent farmers reaping the fruits of their labour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_AQ3}Castle Curemonte
Settlement.text: {==Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_AQ3}Castle Curemonte stands proudly as one of Aquitaine's oldest strongholds. Adorned with ancient Aquitainian tapestries that trace back to the dukedom's founding, this captivating castle combines Aquitaine's typical grandeur with breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AQ2_2}Gradignan
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AQ3_1}Just a stone's throw away from the formidable walls of Castle Curemonte lies the village of Bergerac. While relatively unremarkable, life in Gradignan is a delicate balance, as the peasants navigate the thin line between sustenance and boredom, no doubt thanks to its rather safe position.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AQ2_2}Bergerac
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AQ3_2}Situated somewhat north of Castle Curemonte is the humble hamlet of Bergerac. While the village does not get as much trade as its neighbouring settlements, it still benefits from the dukedom's more peaceful setting. Most of its traffic comes from its prosperous mining community thanks to the discovery of a silver deposit nearby.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_CC1}Castle Carcassonne
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_CC1} The fortress city and the ducal capital of Carcassonne, Castle Carcassonne sits on an island surrounded by the river Songez. Due to the defensive location Castle Carcassonne is designed to be more of a fortress rather than a city, however there is a small town attached to the castle that acts as a marketplace and hub for many travelers and Knights who seek services.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_CC1_1}Tarbes
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_CC1_1}Located near the Border of Carcassonne and Brionne on the river Brienne, maintains a trusting relationship with the outlying villages of Lunel and Vauvert, having been trade partners for ages past.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_CC1_2}Albi
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_CC1_2}Located at the base of the Irana Mountains, the village of Albi has been host to countless raids from Greenskin tribes. As such, the shepherds have become battle hardened and will defend their village from any oncoming monstrosities.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_CC1_3}Cahors
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_CC1_3}East of Carcassonne lies the farm village of Cahors. Although not very populous, Cahors is an asset to Castle Carcassonne, providing most of their grain to feed the fortress town.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_CC2}Turin
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_CC2}Located in the Vaults , the City of Turin is the capital of the Barony of Savoie. The region is influenced heavily by nearby Tilea, despite this the city and people are steadfastly loyal to Bretonnia. Holding the famed relic, the “Shroud of Gilles le Breton” the City of Turin is a Pilgrimage site to all who follow the Lady of the Lake, and all who seek visions of the Lady.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_CC2_1}Montauban
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_CC2_1}Having been sacked by Greenskin invaders many times in the past, the population of Montebaun is very low. Being one of the few timber villages in carcassonne, the remaining peasants here are often worked to the bone.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_CC2_2}Chanaz
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_CC2_2}Sitting south of the Quenelles border and the river Brienne, the village of Chanaz is a small farming community that provides its grain to the City of Turin.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_CC2_3}Montmélian
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_CC2_3}Just west of Chanaz, along the Breinne river, the small land is home to many olive fields, worked tirelessly by the Tilean influenced Bretonnian peasants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_CC1}Toulouse
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_CC1}Located on the western border of Carcassonne and at the base of the Irana Mountains, Toulouse is a vital defensive position that holds the River Niveau crossing, that separates the border of Carcassonne and Estalia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_CC1_2}Condom
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_CC1_1}Condom is a timber village located in the most north western part of Carcassonne, that borders Estalia and the Duchy of Brionne.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_CC1_2}Muret
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_CC1_2}Nestled in the western Irana Mountains, Muret is a mining town that has become a fierce recruiting ground for Carcassonne Knights. The peasants are avid blacksmiths and miners, and will not shy away from a fight with Greenskins.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_CC1_3}Montesquieu
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_CC1_3}In the green pastures of western Carcassonne lies the village of Montesquieu. The lush fields of green attract many breeds of Bretonnian Horse, which has made the village quite wealthy compared to most Bretonnian villages.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_CC2}Lovarre
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_CC2}A small fortress settlement on the Southern Reach of Bretonnia near the Tilean border. Once besieged by the armies of Tilea, the siege turned to a massacre when Ser Der Raker broke the assailants single handedly.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_CC2_1}Yenne
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_CC2_1}In the eastern plains of Carcassonne, Yenne sits just opposite of the village Perpignan on the river Pou. Just outside of Yenne lies the Burial Mound of Grundsnik, an orc warboss who was defeated many centuries ago. Orcs occasionally come here, seeking to reclaim Grundsnik’s treasure.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_CC2_1}Cugnaux
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_CC2_2}A small mining village on the eastern base of the Irana Mountains and the Western Vaults, the Village of Cugnaux are hardened miners, working iron for the city of Turin and beyond.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_CC2_2}Escalquens
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_CC_3}At the crossing of the river Brienne and the river Pou, Escalquens grows flax for the city of Turin. Because of their Tilean lineage, Escalquens is quite prosperous and rich compared to the surrounding villages.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_CC3}Castle Gaudaron
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_CC3}Located near the borders of the Loren Forrest, Castle Gaudaron is an ever watchful eye that stands at the base of the Vaults mountain range. Castle Gaudaron is a key position for maintaining Bretonnian rule over the northern end of the Novalone Pass, as well as for guarding the Loren highway.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_CC3_1}Salignac La Rouge
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_CC3_1}Salignac La Rouge is the last Bretonnian settlement along the Loren Highway. Travelers heading towards Kreutzhafen will typically pick up anything they need for the long journey there from the peasants here. The people here feel uncomfortably close to the Fey of Cavaroc, but relations with Athel Loren remain as amicable as possible.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_CC3_2}Mont De Marsan
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_CC3_2}A de facto marker for the border between Tilea and Bretonnia, Mont de Marsan sits in the Novalone Pass. Many people here are in fact Tileans who make their living facilitating trade between Carcassonne and Miragliano.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_CC3_3}Perpignan
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_CC3_3}On the coast of the river Pou, near where the tributary feeds into the Brienne, sits the village of Perpignan. Perpignan being so close to the Novalone Pass has a large Tilean influence on the people here.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_QU1}Castle Quenelles
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_QU1}Right on the border between the Land of Chivalry and the Forest of Loren, is Ducal Capital and Fortress-City of Quenelles. The city is so close to the Forest in fact, that the fey have demanded of the Quenellians to tear down the wall on the eastern side. Where the wall ends is met with a broad road and then immediately the fringes of the fey forest.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_QU1_1}Perrache
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_QU1_1}Perrach is a small farming community on the road between Castle Quenelles and Merceaux Descloux. The peasants here nar to go towards the woods in any way, so in fear they are of the Fey who watch over them from the shade of the trees.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_QU1_2}Nailloux
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_QU1_2}In the flatlands of Quenelles, surrounded by a sea of grassgrasses and farmlands, is the village of Nailloux. The peasants here raise cattle on the fine grasses for most of the year. When it comes time to drive the cattle to market in Quenelles, the village becomes nearly uninhabited, as most of the population leaves along with their cattle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_QU1_1}Bézier
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_QU1_3}Nearly in the center of Quenelles, Bézier is an immensely isolated village. The most notable thing about it is the small grail shrine at the northern end of the village.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_QU2}Viefin
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_QU2}Nestled in the hills bordering Massif Orcal, sits the fortress town of Viefin. Viefin was established originally as a garrison to protect Quenelles from Greenskins that come down out of the mountains, as well as a position to launch attempts at founding new villages in the region.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_QU2_1}Chinon
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_QU2_1}Chinon was founded as one of a score of settlements in the Massif Orcal mountains and is the only one still remaining. The peasants here recently found a vein of high quality iron, which has afforded the hamlet much extra protection and vigilance from its protectors.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_QU2_2}Gien
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_QU2_2}Gien is an old timber enterprise, founded long ago to provide building material for the Dukedom. With only the fools willing to even step foot near the forest of the fey, Quenelles sought out a new source of wood. Despite the dangers present in the Forest of Chalons, it is far safer to deal with the cloven ones than anger the elves.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_QU2_3}Mont-Dore
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_QU2_3}On Mont-Dore, is the village of Mont-Dore. The silver mine here is far older than any current human settlement. The village was built here a few years ago, after the older settlement was razed by greenskins.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_QU1}Castle Beaumarchais
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_QU1}Castle Beaumarchais sits strategically between three important areas; Massif Orcal, the border with Parravon and the Loren forest. While Quenellian relations with the fey are… amicable, The Castle was built far enough from the border of the woods to prevent the wood elves interference with its walls such as at Castle Quenelles.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_QUI_3}Merceaux Descloux
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_QU1_1}Founded by Shallyan cultists, Merceaux Descloux has grown as those seeking cures for their ailments have begun to settle around the monastery in thanks. These supplicants have built small homes and tilled the land, providing for everything the cultists here need.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_QU1_2}Montlac
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_QU1_2}At the foot of Massif Orcal, is the hamlet of Montlac. Montlac uses the terraces on the hills around them to grow line after line of grape vines, which are harvested for the tables of Nobles.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_QU1_3}Saint Gaudens
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_QU1_3}Saint Gaudens is along the road that runs between Merceaux Descloux and Castle Quenelles. The people here long ago found a large deposit of clay.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_QU2}Castle Carrard
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_QU2}Castle Carrad sits on the shore of the River Brienne near the border of Carcassonne and the Forest of Loren. Its lord, Leofric Carrard, has inherited the fief in absentia. His father had given him permission to embark on his Grail Quest but as soon as Leofric left, his father grew gravely ill and passed into the arms of the Lady. Duke Tancred II has taken stewardship here until Leofric returns.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_QU1_3}Nice
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_QU2_1}Nice is an old village, so old in fact that some Nobles suspect that the fey originally inhabited it. Despite this suspicion, the Fey have never disturbed the village, at least not in a manner particular compared to the normal demands and restrictions.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_QU2_2}Labège
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_QU2_2}On the river Brienne, Labège sits mostly undisturbed by either invaders or their own lords. The people here are known for their cheese, which is commonly exported out of the Kingdom.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_QU2_3}Grasse
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_QU2_3}Along the road to Brionne is the village of Grasse, named for the tall grasses that grow in this region of Bretonnia. The people here raise notably large cattle on the grasses.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_QU3}Castle Laguiller
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_QU3}Castle Laguiller is both a castle and a major river port along the River Brienne. Nearby is the Grave of Cuileux, a Quenellian holy site where the founder of the Dukedom is entered.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_QU3_1}Brusse
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_QU3_1}On the river Brienne, sits the large farming village of Brusse. It was established by its lord as a plantation to grow flax for the industries in Quenelles.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_QU3_2}Montaudran
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_QU3_2}Montaudran is an isolated community, known only for their cultivation of cotton on the fertile plains north of Castle Laguiller. The village is remarkably close to the Grave of Cuileux, the people here are used to the sight of knights coming and going to pay their respects to the long dead hero.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_QU3_3}Borderouge
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_QU3_3}Borderouge is the last stop on the road before the Quenellian - Brionnian border. There is a tavern in the village, catering to traveling knights and merchants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_MS1}Castle Mousillon
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.town_MS1} In the abyssal, death-ridden swamps formed by the slowing of the River Grismerie, Castle Mousillon slowly descends into the boundless depths of Mousillon’s murky waters. Mousillon itself thrives on barter and trade within the walls itself, many believe even more unsavoury acts happen deep within the city. Laden with dark lit taverns, unsavoury brothels, and dens of thieves, Mousillon is a haven for the enemies of Bretonnia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MS1_1}Le Marais Mort
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MS1_1}Located just north of Mousillon, Les Marais Mort is hidden just beyond a vast number of hills, called Les Collines de Charnel. The village is barebones and infested with peasants afflicted by various mutations, many believe the origin to be long lost diseases emanating from Le Collines de Charnel.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MS1_2}Gorges
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MS1_2}Residing on the northern bank of the Grismerie river, the small settlement of Gorges houses many humans and mutants alike. Being even poorer than most Bretonnian settlements, Gorges stays afloat with communal fishing and what little they can scratch out of the ground. When they aren’t levied into their lord's armies.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MS1_1}La Grange
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MS1_3}La Grange, nicknamed “The Barn”, houses many steeds who would dare to graze into the foetid swamps of Mousillon. Although a breeding ground for livestock, it is also popular for mutants and humans that need safe dwelling from the foul creatures of the night.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_MS1}Castle Rachard
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_MS1} Across the border of Lyonesse, Castle Rachard is lorded over by none other than Lord Rachard himself. Surprisingly, these lands are fairly established and well kept considering Mousillon’s hellish landscape and numerous dangers. Some adventurers and villagers say they hear noises coming from the castle, however no one has ever investigated the ongoing activities within the castle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_MSI_3}Le Rosier Noir
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_MS1_1}Not so much a village but more of a Tavern surrounded by makeshift homes, Le Rosier Noir is a small gathering hub for many unwanted vagrants and shifty wanderers. Indeed it is remarkable the small village houses mostly humans and not any mutants. The few houses surrounding the village are home to the manystaff at Le Rosier Noir.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_MS2}Castle Hane
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_MS2}Castle Hane is a tall hexagonal tower that stands near the Grismerie river, on a small island in the swamps. Lorded over by Aucassin, a long reigning noble of bretonnia, the surrounding villages are surprisingly livable by Mousillon standards. Surrounding the tower are many stables for Aucassin’s Vampiric Knights, and any who would visit the tower.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_MS1_3}Yremy
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_MS2_1}A small hamlet that is isolated from most of Mousillon itself, Yremy is home to a great number of humans, rather than mutants. Many of the peasants residing in the village work for Lord Aucassin and work in his kitchen at Chateau Hane. Yremy does get some trade because of its closeness to Grenouille Gate however.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_BK1}Blood Keep
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_BK1}Once the home of a valiant order of Knights known as the Order of the Blood Dragon, or the Ordo Draconis. One fateful night, a Vampire known as Walach Harkon challenged every Knight to single combat, eventually turning all who he deemed worthy into Vampires. The entirety of the Ordo Draconis was then wiped from existence and became known as the Blood Dragons.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_AL1}Yn Edryl Koiran
Settlement.text: {=!}Altdorf is at once perhaps the greatest city of the Empire and perhaps the entire known world, only rivaled in its size and importance by the likes of Marienburg, Nuln and Erengrad. Emperor Karl Franz rules both the Grand Principality of the Reikland and the Empire of Sigmar from this sprawling city, and what better a capital than the city founded by Sigmar himself two and a half millennia ago? Besides for its history, Altdorf is geographically the focal point of trade for three quarters of the Empire; for here all of the goods and travel from the states of Ostermark, Talabecland, Hochland, Stirland, Wissenland and Averland must go before they can move down the Reik to Marienburg and beyond. The city also hosts numerous knightly orders, the center of the Sigmarite church and the eight Imperial colleges of magic. Despite this prosperity and importance, Altdorf is a restless city: overpopulated and ripe for political violence, much of the fair city and its services have been pushed to their limits.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL1_1}Tal Eth Ayr
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL1_1}Frederheim is a small Reiklander village just north of Altdorf on the Altdorf-Middenheim road. While the town is a possession of Karl-Franz and is a part of Altdorf’s demesne, the Emperor has seen fit to give oversight of it in all but name to the Cult of Shallya. This is a result of the cult's request for an area in which to establish a walled hospice and sanatorium.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL1_2}Tal Cullon
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL1_2}On the eastern side of the confluence of the rivers Taal and Reik sits the village of Kaldach. The town is notable particularly for being the demarcation of the Reikland/Talabecland border. Besides this, it remains a small farming community.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL1_3}Tal Govorn
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL1_3}Directly west of Altdorf, between the river Reik and the Weissbruck canal is the village of Hochloff. The town is known for the type of grain it raises the Hochloffkorn which is very well regarded for making a high quality flour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL1_4}Tal Merion
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL1_3}Directly west of Altdorf, between the river Reik and the Weissbruck canal is the village of Hochloff. The town is known for the type of grain it raises the Hochloffkorn which is very well regarded for making a high quality flour.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_AL2}Crag Halls of Findol
Settlement.text: {=!}At the Confluence of the River Reik and the River Schilder sits the town of Schilderheim. Ruled by Graf Robert von Uhland, Schilderheim is an important river market down river from altdorf, being one of the last places that trade on the River Reik can stop before reaching Marienburg.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL2_1}Tal Jul-Finel
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL2_1}Holthusen is a town in western Reikland on the river Schilder. By road it lies between Eilhart and Schilderheim. The town's primary trade good is the Holthusen Hogshead barrel which is used across the empire to age or ferment their products before shipment. The barrels are said to be so sturdy as to be able to protect their contents even from direct cannon fire. Every year Holthusen hosts the Weinfest, a great gathering for wine tasting that requires an invite to enter. Of course the lack of invite does not stop the horde of wastrels and rogues who wish to drink the free wine provided by the festival. Weinfest also marks the only time of year during which the Golden Cask is brought out, which is said to contain the best wine in the Empire if not the entire Old World. Due to the town's forested location, it is frequently attacked by beastmen. The palisades and guards are normally strong enough to see the monsters off, but the townspeople fear the day this defence falls short. As such, some of the townspeople have been leaving casks of cheap wine at the edge of the woods in an attempt to appease the beastmen with tribute. This dubious practice likely will not be allowed to continue much longer.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL2_2}Tal Varigan
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL2_2}Eilhart remains its mark on the map for one reason; the popularity of its vintage of white wine. Eilhart wine is one of the Reiklands best wines, valued for its crisp light flavours and its mild hangovers. Eilhart is a destination for riverboat cruises, where wealthy merchants and nobles from Altdorf often come up the river to taste the various local vintages and foods. Many of the people here are said to have bretonnian heritage, visitors often comment on the similar bone structure shared by many of the inhabitants.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_AL3}Coeth-Mara
Settlement.text: {=!}At the head of the Axe Bite pass sits the town of Helmgart. Ruled by Margrave Reinhardt von Mackensen, the fortress town serves as both the economic and military border between Bretonnia and the Empire. Axe Bite is one of three mountain passes through the Grey mountains; as such the safety of passage through it is a primary concern. Helmgart itself is a market town, surrounded by several curtain walls. One of these walls traverses the entire width of the pass itself, meaning all travel must pass through its single gate or be stuck on either the Bretonnian or Imperial side of the border.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL3_1}Tal Amere
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL3_1}Ussingen is a small village located on the road between Holthusen and Osburg. The town is at the furthest point that the River Schilder remains navigable by barge, meaning that many shipments bound for Helmgart will arrive first here. The people here raise crops along the river Schilder and will venture into the nearby Grey Mountains to mine seams of ore. The town is well protected by the walls at Helmgart, and really only worries about the denizens of the Reikwald.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL3_2}Tal Drost
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL3_2}Morlenfurt is a small village near the headwaters of the river Bogen. The town is known for its silver mines and the small community of Dwarfs which contribute to the silver trade within the Reikland.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL3_3}Tal Mora
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL3_2}Morlenfurt is a small village near the headwaters of the river Bogen. The town is known for its silver mines and the small community of Dwarfs which contribute to the silver trade within the Reikland.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_AL4}Halls of Anaereth
Settlement.text: {=!}Bögenhafen is a prominent market town that sits on either side of the River Bögen. It is midway between Altdorf and Montfort allowing the town to maintain its economic importance through nearly any hardship. The northside of the town, known as the Pit, is the smallest and poorest section of Bögenhafen. The Southside of the town is where most of the wealth and all of the town’s important institutions reside, including its religious temples and town hall. A town council rules in the name of Graf Wilhelm von Saponatheim.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL4_1}Tal Hakan
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL4_1}At the foot of the Axe Bite Pass sits the village of Osburg, the last Imperial settlement before the Market fortress of Helmgart and the Imperial/Bretonnian border. Any shipments bound for Helmgart must pass first through Osburg, and this source of trade makes the merchants here fairly prosperous.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL4_2}Tal Brianda
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL4_2}To the north northwest of Bögenhafen is the timber producing village of Herzhald. Situated deep in the Reikwald, Herzhald is known for the quality and lengths of its timber samples, much of which is sent to Bögenhafen and Grünburg for their boatbuilding.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL4_3}Tal Valerin
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL4_3}To the north northwest of Bögenhafen is the timber producing village of Herzhald. Situated deep in the Reikwald, Herzhald is known for the quality and lengths of its timber samples, much of which is sent to Bögenhafen and Grünburg for their boatbuilding.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL4_3}Tal Rond
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL4_4}To the north northwest of Bögenhafen is the timber producing village of Herzhald. Situated deep in the Reikwald, Herzhald is known for the quality and lengths of its timber samples, much of which is sent to Bögenhafen and Grünburg for their boatbuilding.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_AL5}Feast Halls of the Wardance
Settlement.text: {=!}Ubersreik is one of the most important trade centers in Reikland. It sits astride and important bridge on the road from from Bögenhafen to Dunkelburg. Trade flows along the road as well as downriver to Auerswald, Grünburg, Kemperbad, and Altdorf. In addition, because it is located near Grey Lady Pass, Ubersreik is the ideal location for merchants travelling over the Grey Mountains to move their wares from the river to overland transportation, and vice versa.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL5_1}Threllock
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL5_1}Geissbach is a forest village just north of Ubersreik. The people here carefully timber the woods nearby and grow what crops they can in the clearings around the village. For a long time there have been rumors and worries about a dark estate just east of the village, which is said to house great evil.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_AL6}Glade of Eternal Midnight
Settlement.text: {=!}On the northern bank of the River Grissen is the market town of Dunkelburg. Dunkelburg benefits from being along the Stimmigen canal, which allows access to many of the market towns in Reikland’s southern region. The town is known for its rustic feel which seems to be preserved in the town despite its continued increase in size. Unfortunately, Dunkelburg’s proximity to the Grey Mountains has doomed it to be plagued by Goblins, who regularly raid the town. One of the results of these raids is that the town has a much higher population of Orphans than many other parts of the Empire. These orphans are provided for by the von Wallensteins however, as long as they work in the town’s several Bleachfields that is.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL6_1}Tal Stornos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL6_1}Barfsheim is a small village along the river Grissen near the Countess Emmanuelle canal. Its grain often is exported out of the Reikland to feed Grissenwald and Nuln.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AL6_2}Talrennic
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AL6_2}Steindorf is a small village near the headwaters of the river Grissen. Its people refuse to travel into the Grey Mountains that often overshadow the village. Despite the fact that the minerals would bring great wealth to the village, the people here speak of a dread castle in the mountains above them, saying that they would rather remain in their vale with their grain.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_AL1}Vaul’s Anvil
Settlement.text: {=!}In the Suden Vorbergland of Reikland sits the market town of Stimmigen. Stimmigen sits on the river Ober, where the Stimmigen and Grey Lady canals meet. The town is especially famous for Ernwald, a variety of apples known for its sweet, yet tart taste, that the people of Stimmigen put into pies, pastries, crumbles and cider, as well as the infamous local dish ‘rat-apple stew.’ Stimmigen has a large population of Halflings, who specialise in the Ernwald cultivation as well as its derivative goods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AL1_1}Tal Dovar
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AL1_1}Naffdrof is an isolated village that sits along the Grey Lady Canal between Stimmigen and Hugeldal. Naffdrof is almost entirely surrounded by a marshland created by the nearby rivers Teufel, Ober and Tranig. In truth there is not much reason to stop in Naffdrof, the village's main commodity is the fish that use the canals to move between the rivers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_AL2}The Halls of Equos
Settlement.text: {=!}The Grand Freistadt of Kemperbad is a major trade city that sits at the confluences of the rivers Riek and Stir. The city holds a commanding position over this portion of the river trade and is crucial to ensuring the southern empires continued economic prosperity. The city purchased its charter from Emperor Boris the Incompetent in 1066 IC, from then on being ruled directly by the Council of Thirteen which represents the largest merchants in town plus representatives from the local temples of Sigmar and Shallya.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AL2_1}Tal Amara
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AL2_1}Diesdorf is a small town on the river Reik located between Altdorf and Kemperbad. Diesdorf is a major holy site of the Cult of Sigmar, it is said that Magnus the Pious once made a powerful and stirring speech to the crowds who had gathered to hear him. Around sixty years ago, Emperor Wilhelm III founded the Diesdorf Military college to train those who have proven their leadership abilities in battle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_AL3}Tal Enda Varian
Settlement.text: {=!}Castle Reiksguard is the fortress of the Grand Order of the Reiksguard Knights. It sits on the confluence of the rivers Teufel and Reik. In the time of Emperor Sigismund, while the Reikland was under threat of Gorbad Ironclaw, it was refortified and increased in size by dwarfen architects. It remains a powerful citadel capable of holding hundreds of soldiers and staff and serves as Karl-Franz’s summer home.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AL3_1}Locrimere
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AL3_1}Worlitz is a river village protected by the forces garrisoning the Castle Reiksguard. The people here are very loyal directly to the Emperor Karl-Franz who many believe to be a reincarnation of Sigmar. The town benefits from trade heading down the Reik to Altdorf, Marienburg and beyond.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AL3_2}Waterfall Palace of the Naiad Court
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AL3_2}The town of Grünburg sits on the river Teufel. While trade flows through the town from the canals to itself and from the Reik to its north, Grünburg’s main source of wealth comes from its river boatyards, where many of the boats and barges that ply the rivers of the Reikland originate from. The town is also famous for the Battle of Grünburg where the advance of Orc Warlord Gorbad Ironclaw was finally halted around a half a millenia ago. The battle plains is valued particularly due to the fact that nearly all of the Imperial and orc forces present were mounted calvarymen, unusual for both the contemporary period and the modern era. As such an excavation site has been established by several interested parties and many come to look upon their work.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_AL4}Tal Esth
Settlement.text: {=!}Castle Grauenburg is the seat of Graf Wilhelm von Saponatheim’s rule over the central Reikland and his barony. It is a fortress along the river Bogen that protects Bogenhafen and other nearby locations from attack.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AL4_1}The Summer Tree
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AL4_1}Weissbruck sits on the joining of the Weissbruck Canal and the river Bӧgen. The town once was a major source of coal and iron in the Reikland, the mining of which provided the Gruber family with enough funds to construct the Weissbruck Canal, which enabled easier transportation of the mined material to market. Now the mines have mostly been depleted and while the town continues to have prosperous ventures in trade thanks to the canal, the many former workers of the mine have found themselves unemployed and stuck in Weissbruck, where they spend their time drinking cheap alcohol and causing trouble.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_AL5}Tal Driacha
Settlement.text: {=!}Castle Grauenburg is the seat of Graf Wilhelm von Saponatheim’s rule over the central Reikland and his barony. It is a fortress along the river Bogen that protects Bogenhafen and other nearby locations from attack.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AL5_1}Delliandra
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AL4_1}Weissbruck sits on the joining of the Weissbruck Canal and the river Bӧgen. The town once was a major source of coal and iron in the Reikland, the mining of which provided the Gruber family with enough funds to construct the Weissbruck Canal, which enabled easier transportation of the mined material to market. Now the mines have mostly been depleted and while the town continues to have prosperous ventures in trade thanks to the canal, the many former workers of the mine have found themselves unemployed and stuck in Weissbruck, where they spend their time drinking cheap alcohol and causing trouble.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AL5_2}Tal Silvoch
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AL4_2}Just to the south west of altdorf is the small village of Heiligen. The village is nothing to speak of, but it is near the amber hills, which offer a spectacular view of Altdorf from their height.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_AL6}Tyr Vanna
Settlement.text: {=!}Castle Grauenburg is the seat of Graf Wilhelm von Saponatheim’s rule over the central Reikland and his barony. It is a fortress along the river Bogen that protects Bogenhafen and other nearby locations from attack.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AL6_1}Tyr Edrell
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AL4_1}Weissbruck sits on the joining of the Weissbruck Canal and the river Bӧgen. The town once was a major source of coal and iron in the Reikland, the mining of which provided the Gruber family with enough funds to construct the Weissbruck Canal, which enabled easier transportation of the mined material to market. Now the mines have mostly been depleted and while the town continues to have prosperous ventures in trade thanks to the canal, the many former workers of the mine have found themselves unemployed and stuck in Weissbruck, where they spend their time drinking cheap alcohol and causing trouble.
